column38: 展覽根據主題分為【東墨系現代水墨之旅】、【天人合一 與傳統的對話】、【流風之美 時代書藝】、【華藝鏡像 海外社團】、【佛光藝緣】五大專場。本次活動共收到中國大陸、香港、澳門、臺灣、日本、韓國、新加坡、越南、泰國、印尼、菲律賓、汶萊、馬來西亞、加拿大、美國、澳洲、巴西、英國、法國、德國、義大利、西班牙、荷蘭、比利時等24個國家和地區藝術家共370人的515件作品。同時出版有關本次活動展品畫集共五冊。洛陽美術館館長文柳川與著名文藝評論家曹天博士分別致詞，海外藝術家代表馬來西亞國際現代書畫聯盟會長符永剛博士、

column21: 洋人旅粵指南──廣州自助遊全攻略II (結局篇)
column29: The Leisure and Cultural Services Department
column37: This exhibition was a follow-up “Travel Guide” of “The Ultimate South China Travel Guide — Canton” staged in 2009. It focused on the changes of interest to travellers, as well as the evolution of export painting in the post-Opium War period. The exhibitio
column38: 本展覽乃2009年推出之「洋人旅粵指南——廣州自助遊全攻略」之「續集」，繼續採用旅遊指南的設計，重點介紹鴉片戰爭後的廣州「自助遊」情報，及外銷畫的發展。展品主要從本館所藏歷史繪畫作品中展出64組藏品，大多為描繪18、19世紀南中國地形風貌的油畫、水彩、素描、版畫及外銷工藝品。

column37:
The two little toes draw brilliant colors,
that bring joy and hope to every heart.
Each painting is full of vitality and revealed with a grateful heart.
Let us feel the love.
column38:
兩只小腳趾畫出絢麗的顏色,
為每一顆心田帶來喜樂與盼望。
每一幅滿載生命力的畫作都顯露著一顆感恩的心,
讓我們感受愛。

column20: 伙炭開放日《失覺》 - 姚柱東、黃向藝作品展
column21: 伙炭開放日《失覺》 - 姚柱東、黃向藝作品展
column37: Sensible versus non-sensible; normal versus abnormal – human beings like to use these opposite binaries to define what it means by a 'normal' way of living. Nevertheless, what is known as normal is only a constraint sculpted by the modern social and cultural ideology which makes everyone follow the same direction to develop and to conform, disregarding all other way of living outside the acceptable frame. Just as Michel Foucault quoted in the preface of his writing 'Madness and Civilization', Russian writer Fyodor Dostoyevsky said: "Men cannot use their imprisoned neighbour to affirm that they themselves are mentally stable." In fact, many voices are buried within the so called 'sensible' power. One would have the question of whose belief it is that is restricting people from choosing other ways of living? It may now be time to reflect on this subject and to erase any thinking that is bounded by frames of the society.
column38: 理性與非理性、正常與失常，人們都喜歡以這樣的二元對立，去解釋何謂「正常」的生存方式。然而，所謂的正常，都只不過是現今社會型態和文化模式下的一個規範，使所有人都依循社會的發展方向而被馴化，排除一切規範之外的生活模式。如傅柯（Michel Foucault）在《瘋癩與文明》前言中，引述俄國作家杜斯妥也夫斯基（Fyodor Dostoyevsky）所道︰「人們不能用禁錮自己的鄰人來確認自己神智健全。」事實上，在我們今日的生活中，仍存著很多被「理性」強權所壓制的聲音，究竟是誰的「真理」在規管著人們多元的生活選擇？或許是時候需要重新的思想，抹化被框架的思維。

column19: "World Wide Wandering" Debut Photo-exhibition with Jill VC
column21: "World Wide Wandering" Debut Photo-exhibition with Jill VC
column37:
HAJI Gallery proudly presents our 15th exhibition featuring a young gifted artist's debut photo exhibition - "WWW 2012 by Jill VC". You may ask how young she is.

Exhibition description

'WWW 2012 by Jill VC is a conglomeration of our worlds crazy, beautiful, and down right unexplainable - moments captured in different, time zones, area codes and atmospheres through the vision of a wandering teen on her lone travels around the world. This is Jill via city, and her life via lens.'

Artist's Description

Jillian C, known as Jill VC, is an aspiring photojournalist and and visual artist of 17 years in Hong Kong. Born in the 852 and raised in Vancouver, British Columbia, World Wide Wandering is her first ever debut exhibition after a lifelong relationship with visual media and the arts, showcasing the four corners of the globe through her eyes.

column37: Tapani’s MOD collection is inspired by a playful look at contradictions in design. Taking the clean, non-complex form of the cube and applying this to modular structure, each piece is constructed with simple and strong forms. The cubes are taken further, produced with intricate detailing, rich materials and workmanship. Each cube is handcrafted at the hand of Artisans and can be twisted and turned to produce patterns while promoting interaction and creativity from the user

column37: Artist Wong Wing Tong’s idea comes from the light research of the Impressionist, which considered that the light is important to the drawing. The painter first observes the relationship between lights and the projectile and then presents by painting. At the same time, the painting also becomes a channel to reveal his aspirations on how the people at that time interpret and feel about the nature and science. Wong does not aim to show the changes of light and shade at the physical image, but the direct description of light’s existence, from another angle depicting the meaning of the following scenes.

column38:
在2月4日至26日，我和插畫家星拍齊將合作舉行一個名為《the weather report 天氣報告詩+圖展》，我寫詩他繪圖，用兩隻小熊去說明，愛情就是勇往直前。這個天氣報告其實是我和他在國內商旅雜誌《e行天下》的連載專欄，出了兩期便獲得填詞人夏至的邀請，在她太平山街的Haji Gallery作展覽。我們2月4日當日五至七時會有小小的開幕酒會，希望你能來參加，給我們指導。謝謝你。

吳家強

column37: “The Art of Dress” is not concerned with fashion or glamour or the cut, colour, drape, fit, function or feel of any particular garments or any particular period, community or style.   Instead, “The Art of Dress” features artists who use the idea of clothing as a metaphor for the body and the fact that we are all individually, gloriously different, but connected to one another through our humanity.  It explores the essence of dress as an abstract concept and aims to explore the notion of the everyday made universal through art.  For each of the artists in this exhibition, the art of dress is a metaphor for personal experiences that now only exist in memory.

column9: Room 2009, 20/F, Cable TV Tower, 9 Hoi Shing Road, Tsuen Wan, NT., Hong Kong
column37: Weapon has been Jia Jing’s indulgence for years. In his early works, he smooths weapons, soldiers, regimentals and any war-related objects that we can think of into a series of aesthetic pictures. Recently, Jia Jing persistently studies and explores the impacts of war on culture, society, and behaviours and thoughts of people. The artist aims to reveal the hidden violence in the subconsciousness of human beings. The direct depiction is going to fade and being transformed to a tranquiller, gentler and smoother imagery which projects the artist’s unique force, aura and mentality. This transcended imagery is a particular aesthetics judgment carried a hidden field of force that is an ultimate retort to the violence itself and a more reasonable sentence.

column30: 香港建築師學會、香港規劃師學會及香港設計師協會主辦，深圳城市 \ 建築雙年展組織委員會合辦
column37:
In Hong Kong, roof shanties on high rise buildings have become an alternative typology of our hyperdense building culture. They form a particular urban fabric interweaving multiple levels and distances. Here the artist, Frank Havermans, together with local metalsmiths, arrives Wan Chai Visual Archive and reconceptualizes a mutation of roof shanty - with its domestic function and enclosure being removed - on the rooftop of a typical Tong-Lau in Hong Kong.
Now brought to life, the roof art installation reveals, rotates, and retracts from time to time. Inherited with a gene of vernacular architecture, this creature lives in between regulation and reason, action and affection, position and boundary. It has learnt to improvise the city, in order to survive....
column38:
在香港，天台屋已經成為本地的另類高密度建築, 交織著多個生活層面和城市空間。藝術家哈化瑪斯與灣仔社區內的傳統鐵器工匠合作，應邀在灣仔視集身處的舊樓頂層起壇作法，將天台建築演化成沒有功能、零實用面積的藝術裝置。
這裝置猶如獨立的新生命體，承傳民間營造的精神，自身可伸縮旋轉，時而展露又時而隱藏，游走於法理、裡外、動靜、閒作之間。這樣變型複合的建築模式，隨機而行，正是在城市生存的必要策略......

column37:
The intercultural group of students analysed existing models of sustainable fashion and its consumption. Based on their research, they created their individual ideas and visions. A variety of student work in the area
of information design and intermedia design will be presented in this exhibition. Information graphics, books, magazines, online-portals, mobile apps and digital media-systems show approaches for giving consumer guidelines and orientation in their daily life.

column35: Tang Ying Chi, Lau Ching Ping
column38: 繼去年《擺拍博物館—程展緯與謝至德對談展》大獲好評後，光影作坊於今年 度延續「藝術家與攝影師對話系列」，邀請了藝術家鄧凝姿與攝影創作人劉清平對談。兩位以不同媒介創作的藝術家在半年間的多次對談中，由創作方式、思考視覺談至表象與現實，最後落定城市與消逝這命題。兩人對這城市的感覺仿如海市蜃樓般朦朦朧朧、似真還假，以光創造想像和遠景，用畫筆與相機交織出這道城市的光景。

特首造像」系列至今已是第四屆。第一屆於1996年蘊釀第一屆行政長官選舉時舉行，第二屆於2002年中央染指欽點第二屆行政長官時舉行，第三屆於2003年董特首在任期間民怨沸騰時舉行。

而正值第三任特首「選舉」期間，我們籌辦第四次「特首造像」藝術活動，透過藝術去標誌著特首這角色在香港歷史上的不同重要時刻。……

是次展覽，我們邀請十多位本地藝術家參與，共同表達對未來特首的期望……

column15: Chinese Painting, Calligraphy and Seal Carving
column37: February 24, 2012 - VA GALLERY proudly presents Spring Blossoms – Chinese Master Jia Pingxi’s Ink Exhibition. Jia Pingxi, 1964, graduated from Lu Xun Academy of Fine Arts, Chinese Painting Department specializing in flower and bird paintings. His works are collected by the National Art Museum of China, Academy of traditional Chinese Paintings of China, Zhongnanhai, as well as Japan, Australia, France, Britain, Germany, Singapore, Russia, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Korea and other art museums. Published in many art collections, such as "Jia Pingxi Paintings Collection.” He has held an Art Conference in Beijing's Great Hall of the People.

column35: Junichi Arai, Louise Lemieux Berube, Philippa Brock, Lia Cook, Wen-Ying Huang, Liz Williamson
column37: The Fashion Gallery of the Institute of Textiles and Clothing (ITC) is pleased to present the exhibition “Digital Jacquard: Mythologies” showcasing masterpieces by six renowned artists Junichi Arai, Louise Lemieux Bérubé, Philippa Brock, Lia Cook, Wen-Ying Huang, and Liz Williamson, who passionately involved in the cutting edge of the art. By means of the magical Jacquard technique, the artists create aesthetical pleasing textile arts in various forms, patterns and express a variety of sensational themes. Jacquard textile is one of the oldest and most sophisticated types of textile. Now the combination of computerized design and Jacquard technique creates limitless possibility of fascinating textiles.

column37: Each year, during the Paris Photo event, the galerie du jour presents a joint exhibition mixing the work of photographers to whom it gives loyal support with that of new talent in contemporary photography, through Nos découvertes. On aime la photographie! combines and contemplates works in colour and black and white, around a theme which has misused and revitalized: the portrait of humanity in the context of its time.

column9: White Cube Hong Kong 50 Connaught Road Central
column37:
This monumental body of 292 pictures is the largest series yet created by the acclaimed British artists. 22 pictures were shown in Hong Kong, the first venue on a global tour.

For five decades, to international acclaim, Gilbert & George have been making art that is visionary, shocking, relentless, moral and richly atmospheric.
column38:
White Cube Hong Kong宣布將以世界著名藝術家Gilbert & George的 ‘The London Pictures’作為其開幕展覽。這個全球首展系列一共有292幅作品，是兩位藝術家歷來規模最大的作品系列。作為世界巡迴展覽的首站，是次香港展覽將會展出其中的22幅作品。

在過去五十年的藝術生涯中，Gilbert & George一直持之以恆地創作了無數令人震驚、富於想像力和充滿道德意識的非凡藝術作品，備受世人推祟。

column37: Love starts from our home – Tsin Ngai Centre, where all members are bonded by it. This exhibition shows their livelihood, their handicrafts, ceramic and collective creations. Thru their collaborative effort, an inclusive platform is created and it helps to enhance public understanding of intellectually disabled and their creativity potentials.
column38: 愛是由家出發在展毅中心這大家庭中, 充滿著學員、家屬及職員的愛。藉著是次展覽, 以各類手工、紮染、陶瓷及集體創作, 展示中心內的生活點滴。透過大家同心協力, 締造一個奔向共融的平台, 令社區人士增加了解智障人士及他們的創意潛能。

column19: Another Sphere –Painting Exhibition by people with autism
column20: 界 - 自閉症人士繪畫作品展
column21: 界 - 自閉症人士繪畫作品展
column37: Most autistic individuals may lack the verbal capacity to convey their feelings. However, through painting and drawing, they can fully express their inner world, their love and likings, their perseverance, and their amazing visual memory. Entitled Another Sphere, this exhibition invites viewers to go beyond their own boundary and enter the sphere of autistic individuals. It is intended to be their mind broadening and enriching experience that brings joy to them. This exhibition shows mainly two-dimensional works, featuring the artist s’ individual stories.
column38: 自閉症人士，他們大多不善於用言語來表達他們的感受，但是，卻可以用繪畫來描畫出獨特的內心世界。他們的喜與愛，他們的堅持，他們非一般的視覺記憶。展覽定名為”界”，希望我們在看過展覽後，與自閉症人士之間的界限可以被跨越，也希望我們看過之後心界可以敞開，變得更快樂! 展覽以平面作品為主，每人藉此講述自己的故事。

column19: "Post 70 Art Exhibition" Art Exhbition by Dr. Kan Tai-keung SBS
column20: 靳埭強 七十後作品展
column21: 靳埭強 七十後作品展
column37: HAJI Gallery proudly presents “Post 70 Art Exhibition” featuring the world-renowned designer and artist Doctor Kan Tai Keung. To celebrate Doctor Kan’s 70th birthday and kick-start his series of exhibitions in 2012, Doctor Kan will exhibit 70 pieces of work at HAJI Gallery starting on his 70th birthday on March 04, 2012. Doctor Kan brings unique work of art made from his previous works. Proceeds of the exhibition will be donated to“Kan Tai Keung Design Award” to support Art and Culture.
column38:
國際著名設計大師及藝術家靳埭強，將於七十大壽當日在 HAJI Gallery 展出七十幅作品，也為靳叔在 2012 年一系列大型展覽揭開序幕。獲無數獎項殊榮，經常在海外各地展出作品的靳叔，採集他過往的作品，重新創作七十幅獨一無二的藝術作品，作為七十後之藝術申延。展覽之盈餘將撥捐「靳埭強設計獎」，以推動文化藝術。

靳叔談展覽概念：
“人生每十年都是一個階段，試總結和前瞻： ⋯⋯ 我在十歲時正體驗學校的生活和憧憬； 二十歲時正在社會大學磨練又遇愛情的困惑； 三十歲時正在尋求理想亦要成家立室； 四十歲時正沉醉藝術與設計的生活，勇往直前； 五十歲時活動空間不斷擴大，樂於互動交流； 六十歲時對文藝發展與教育改革熱誠末減； 七十歲童心未泯，回視往事舊物，玩樂在創意之中。

就這樣，度過了七十年的歲月。喜歡做的就做，有些事做了很多，意想不到的多；亦有一些事還想做得更多更好，會繼續爭取時間去做。年青人說我像小孩；成年人說我還有火；但我正在學習退步、謙恭、放下…

迷你建議主辦我一個展覽，我就一口答應在她的夏至畫廊中展出 70 件迷你作品，慶祝 70 歲生日。我珍惜這個機緣，檢視我的舊作，思考玩味，留一點手蹟。七十後，再出發，還是我用我法，畫自我心，本無法，實無求。”--- 靳埭強

column37: Will Hui was born in HK and became a freelance photographer since 2008. In 2009, he has set up his own studio for creation in HK. He launched his first solo photo exhibition in 2010, namely “Zero Sensation” in Wuhan, China. Now he is spending much time working in China. The theme of his photography is a wide coverage of different perspectives focusing on expressing his self-emotion and unique perspectives in life, purely by the use of black and white photography.

column9: Gallery Livi, No.5 Ladder Street, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong
column37: A place with no outer intervention - which means no cut off of any kind of relationship, is what she desired for since solitary tender age. Of bridge, of tunnel, of abandoned land, of jungle, the space of her paintings is created by the escapism of the artist. The artist would like to “create” a space that is irrelevant to any kind of social practice, in return, she can hide into these spaces without being noticed by the adult, i.e. she can sleep on the mud, she can sing a ballad at the roof of the school, she can listen to the sound of the explosion near the tunnel. And if she likes, she can invite people from anywhere (but not in any particular relation with her) to join her. According to Foucault, the heterotopic sites are opposite to utopia and are outside of all places, even though it may be possible to indicate their location in reality as “a sort of simultaneously mythic and real contestation of the space in which we live”. Albeit there are bundles of mixed, unreal experience exit in the heterotopia, Alice by her sensitivity and endless craving on the inner space, is able to mimics the real place in the reality and produces these counter-sites in her paintings - a placeless place. The placeless place functions as mirror somehow, to allow Alice to use the standpoint of the mirror for discovering her absence from the placeless place (where all actions, communications, relations are in a non-social order), where in contrast she can find her presence over there.

column37:
Janice Heather, throught more than 45 years of painting and sketching her way through life, can be considered to have been on a journey that, while not always a physical one, is no less real we see in our evening TV viewing. However, you could say she has traveled deeper into scenes and sights and attempted to bring their true spirit to view.
This is Janice’s third exhibition in Hong Kong. Born in Western Australia, lived in Hong Kong, on and off, for 30 of the last 39 years and with studios in Hong Kong and Australia Janice remains a full time working artist.

column19: "I think, therefore I paint” KEUNG Wai-kai Solo painting Exhibition
column20: “我思故我畫” 姜偉佳個人畫展
column21: “我思故我畫” 姜偉佳個人畫展
column37: The paintings express how I feel about human nature, especially  people's character and their appearances. For example, a friend's cheerful  and optimistic nature, or my spending harmonious time with a certain  friend who has unusual physical features, has sparked off my passion  to paint them with deep admiration and respect.  Human beings often strive to seek the answers to the questions about life, giving rise to many schools of thinking and philosophical articles, such as "I think, therefore I am." My paintings often stem from a thought, an idea about the human condition and, therefore, I have explored the themes about "hope", "patience" and "meditation", etc. I also emphasize the artistic aspects, such as how to enhance the characteristic and aura of the portrait, and how to use color to create greater aesthetic results.  I love to do portraits, especially portraits of my friends in the Centre, with whom I share my everyday life. They all have distinctive appearances and have similar life experiences as I. Having muscular dystrophy, I face similar health issues and difficulties. My paintings serve as a release of my related thoughts, feelings and concerns.
column38: 是次的展覽作品都是關於自己圍繞對人性的一些感覺。我說的人性，只是對某 人的性格或者外表，很感興趣，吸引自己而執筆繪畫。例如，某位朋友的樂天 性格，令我服膺不已；又或者某人外表獨特，與之相處感覺愉快。這都會成為 我日後造形繪畫的對象，藉此歌頌和讚美。 「我思故我在」這個哲學議題的出現，是因人類是會思考的動物，特別對人生 許多問題的懷疑與困惑而產生的。援引它的句法，出現「我思故我畫」的畫展主 題。思考都是我們的出發點，對人生的疑惑，多少都出現在我的畫題裡，如「盼望」、「忍耐」和「沉思」等。不過更多是藝術的思考，譬如思考如何塑造令形象更加突出、用色多少會更有美感等。 因為我只是鍾意畫畫，特別是畫人像。展出的人像主人翁，全部是與自己一起 生活的院舍朋友，他們的外表獨特，經歷又與自己有相似之處。自己都是殘疾 人士，患有肌肉萎縮症，面對著健康的問題，時常都會感到一些困惑和疑問， 潛意式的將情感寄寓和抒發，就這樣出現了這些作品。

column19:
“A parallel world in chaos” 
– Photo Exhibition by Li Shun
column21:
“A parallel world in chaos” 
– Photo Exhibition by Li Shun
column37: As the world we live in becomes more materialistic, our views towards this once tranquil and pure place changes. Our reliance on cars shapes our perception of space and time. My obsession with the city in motion can be traced back to the time I first became part of this accelerating movement. It is as if we can feel the excitement, confusion, anger and momentary silence from such moving images. With visual communication dominating the world, the interpretation and definition of this form of communication is of equal importance to me. Throughout my creative process, I maintain an “on the road” state of mind in conceiving my works, regardless of the expectations of the viewers, authors and critics.

Born in Chongqing, China, Xiao Yu was graduated from the Affiliated School of Sichuan Fine Arts Academy in 1991 and obtained a Degree in Fashion Design at the Academy of Arts and Design, Tsinghua University in 1995. Her debut runway show in China Fashion Week 1998 has earned her a title of “Top Ten Chinese Fashion Designers”. Yu obtained a MA in Fashion Design and Technology in London College of Fashion in 2007 and her graduation work TIME was showcased at the MA “Asylum” Show in Royal Academy of Arts which received rave reviews among media, including Vogue, Evening Standard, and Harper’s Bazaar.

column37:
ART ONE is proud to stage its inaugural art exhibition - Shades & Colors : An Artistic Friendship, where you would see art pieces, in the form of Chromoskedasic Paintings, created by Dominic Lam and Simon Yam

ART ONE is the brand new fine art destination in Hong Kong, located in Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre. It houses an impressive collection of artwork displayed in the most premier art galleries. What’s more, ART ONE offers a spacious venue for art exhibition, in a way to create the perfect ambience for art lovers

column10: 半島維畫廊,ART ONE, 會展廣場辦公大樓閣樓
column35: Cao Hui, Fan Mingzheng, Jiang Huajun, Li Hongjun , Song Kun, Tian Tian, Wei Yan, Wu Di, Wu Haizhou and Xiong Yu
column37:
Starting on March 30th, 2012, VA Gallery will present a group exhibition of 10 artists, “Let Us Speak”. They are: Cao Hui, Fan Mingzheng, Jiang Huajun, Li Hongjun , Song Kun, Tian Tian, Wei Yan, Wu Di, Wu Haizhou and Xiong Yu. Since 2000, they have gained wide attention from the Art market; they are the fresh influential forces in the Chinese contemporary art. Their works are in various forms; realistic sculpture, paper sculpture, realist, oil and mixed media paintings.

Relatively comparing to last century artist, they do not have a fixed symbol, they are more focused on individual inner feelings. In the different trends of the Chinese contemporary art, sometimes, "subject" and "I" are missing in the art. These new artists have full self-reflection consciousness of this phenomenon; their works are no longer a simple canvas.They search deeper meanings and self-identity in their Art. How to concern themselves and express themselves are their attempts on the value and significance of art.

column15: Chinese Painting, Calligraphy and Seal Carving
column37: As a Chinese artist of the new generation, Nan Chao likes to explore the adaptability of materials and is constantly engaged in the search for new creative techniques. According to him, “Artistic creation has two perspectives: first, innovation in language; second, outstepping of concepts that will be found agreeable in the future.” Although Nan Chao is committed to innovation, he remains deeply concerned about the succession of Chinese culture as he has practised ink and wash painting for years. His approach is to provide new interpretation of Chinese culture through merging the past and present, which is composed of three aspects: the shifts of materials, handling of space and reconstruction of early works.

column20: 大阪市立美術館藏 宋、元、明中國書畫珍品展
column37: The Kyoto National Museum is one of the most distinguished museums in Japan.  It possesses very fine Chinese artworks with a collection of 19th and 20th centuries Chinese paintings of high historical value.  This is the first opportunity for the Hong Kong Museum of Art to co-organise an exhibition on Chinese painting with the Kyoto National Museum.  The exhibition features the works by the modern Chinese painters such as Gao Jianfu (1879 – 1951) and Gao Qifeng (1889 – 1933).  It aims to explore the development of modern Chinese paintings under the Japanese influence.  This exhibition also provides a glimpse of the cultural exchanges between China and Japan in the modern era.
column38: 京都國立博物館是日本著名博物館之一，其館藏包括一批十九及二十世紀深具歷史價值的近代中國書畫作品。是次展覽為香港藝術館首次與京都國立博物館協辦展覽，借出的中國書畫藏品包括有近代著名書畫家高劍父（1879 – 1951）及高奇峰（1889 – 1933）等的作品。透過這次展覽觀眾可窺見中國近代繪畫在日本的影響下的發展概況，並從中對當代中日文化交流有進一步認識。

column15: Chinese Painting, Calligraphy and Seal Carving
column37: This exhibition offers its viewers a glimpse into Yi Heda’s and Wu Gaozhong’s daily practices, inspirations of their own pasts and beliefs that materialize as recurring symbols in their art works. Yi Heda's ink circles exemplify Buddhist practices of Zen calligraphy, in which the circle symbolizes enlightenment, the universe and the void. Also recurrent, the hair featured in Wu Gaozhong’s pieces relates to his childhood memory that has since dominated much of his work; a traumatic experience that has sought an outlet in his collection, achieving a serene calmness now present in his works.

column37: Song Yu Min had received the highest and most prestigious honour granted by the PRC government to its artists – the distinction of a “National First Class Artist” and was the second artist to ever hold a solo exhibition at the National Art Museum of China in Beijing. He also held several solo exhibitions and was invited to show in Japan for seven consecutive years. His large scale work is permanently held at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing.

column37: CAAU is an emerging international architectural team working on various prestigious projects around the world. As architects of the Hong Kong Design Institute, this Franco-Belgian couple brought together all their experiences and interests to create a stunning icon for the area. CAAU like to play with the contradictions of a site, and draw on a deep-rooted belief in green design to create an architecture that responds to the environment on a macro and micro scale. Thomas Coldefy was awarded “40 Under 40” Asia and Europe and CAAU have been nominated for AFEx 2012 award.

column37:
Xiaodong is an Artist and Designer from Wuhan. He currently works and lives in Jingdezhen.The conceptual observation of natural phenomenon and the growth developed by Xiaodong has been translated into a sensitive ephemeral expression of nature.
The 2 works presented in the exhibition ‘Rain Drops’ and ‘Colza’ reflects the conceptual research of Xiaodong and the subnatural poetry of our environments.
Working with Porcelain, Xiadong has created a strong paradox and relation between the movement and the growth in Nature and the static qualities of Porcelain.Beyond the Mimesis, ‘De Natura’ proposes to experience an animated environment.

column20: 「衣酷適再生時尚設計香港 2012」總決賽作品展覽
column37: The EcoChic Design Award is a sustainable fashion design competition inspiring Asia’s emerging fashion designers to create maximum appeal clothing with minimal textile waste. Designers are educated with the theory and techniques to enable them to create desirable minimal textile waste clothing. The competition puts Asia’s emerging sustainable design talent under the spotlight, creating a platform for the next generation of designers to change the pattern of fashion forever…
column38: 「衣酷適再生時尚設計」是一個可持續時裝設計比賽，舉辦目的旨在啟發新晉亞洲時裝設計師及學生，以最少織物廢料創造符合大眾市場的高質素設計。比賽把焦點放在亞洲新晉可持續設計師上，提供平台讓新一代設計師從此打破傳統時裝的框架。

column19: " From 20 th Century to Eternity" Italian Design Furniture Exhibition
column20: 「20世紀成就永恆」意大利經典設計傢俱展覽
column37: In collaboration with Fine Art Asia, K11 will sponsor and co-present the most extensive display of Italian Design Furniture Exhibition, in the theme of “From 20th Century to Eternity”, with an exclusive preview exhibition featuring a fine collection of limited edition masterpiece furniture by world renowned Italian designers such as: Ettore Sottsass, Matteo Thun, Michele De Lucchi, Marco Zanuso Jr and Nanda Vigo, all pioneers of furniture design. Alongside the signature works will be another collection of limited edition home decorative accessories created by the acclaimed design icons. These masterpieces will be on display at K11 during the art mall’s Design Month from 1-30 September before moving to Fine Art Asia 2012, Asia’s leading annual international fine art fair at the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre from 4-7 October.
column38: K11與亞洲最頂尖藝術品博覽會 — Fine Art Asia 首次攜手合作，贊助及合辦是次大型意大利經典設計傢俱展覽，並以「20世紀成就永恆」作為是次展覽主題，為創意設計月揭開序幕，展出世界著名意大利設計大師的經典設計傢俱，當中包括 Ettore Sottsass、Matteo Thun、Michele De Lucchi、Marco Zanuso Jr 及 Nanda Vigo 的代表作，與及一系列由大師們設計的限量版家居擺設。這些極具收藏價值的劃時代作品將於9月1日至30日於K11購物藝術館率先預展，其後於10月4日至7日移師至香港會議展覽中心舉行的 Fine Art Asia 2012 亞洲最頂尖藝術品博覽會內公開展出。

column37:
Oursler’s solo exhibition is comprised of three parts. The first part of the exhibition is Oursler’s new series of micro installations, which unfold intricate miniature worlds populated by tiny figures who address each other and the viewer. The combination of Oursler's characters, animations, performances and texts and his elaborate editing structures forms interlocking internal relationships within richly detailed sculptural microcosms. In a new mixture of formal approaches Oursler plays with materials, motion and light, in a scale made possible with tiny new video projection technology. In Pyrite (Murphy’s Law), projected characters suspended in sculpture or trapped in glass orbs engage one another in their own miniature universe.

These themes of convulted human relationships are carried into Oursler's paintings with imbedded moving images, and conceptually complement the micro installations both thematically and graphically. They explore and question the transition of pictorial identity from portrait to computer-based facial recognition systems.

The third segment of the exhibition represents Oursler's Super Pop series, which began in 2002. The artist sees this series as being created in relation to the reductivist depiction of the human form, beginning with stone fertility goddesses and extending through caricature, the smiley face, special effects and on to futuristic avatars. Cosmic Cloud murmurs from a nebulous form made of disparate facial elements and a swath of stars.

column37: This seminal exhibition, the first of its kind in Hong Kong, showcases the artistic achievements of some of the most famous sound artists from home and abroad. Participants include: Christina Kubisch, Leung Chi Wo, Edwin Lo, Cedric Maridet, Kingsley Ng, Ed Osborn, Steve Roden, Remko Scha, Anthony Yeung and Samson Young. Sound art is enjoying a new found celebrity status, combining both visual and auditory elements that offer exciting opportunitites for new forms of multimedia creativity. While contemporary culture is predominantly visual, sound art co-opts this fascination to re-awaken our sense of hearing. When presented in gallery environments sound art fills white walled spaces with its sonorous envelope and voluminous bath of active vibrations This exhibition reveals the intense posticism that arises when sound comes into being within such white walls. Each of the exhibiting artists will choose a particular space within the Creative Media Centre to locate their work, and thereby enliven the building and enthral its visitors with their synesthetic art of seeing + hearing.

column9: Asia Art Archive, 11/F Hollywood Centre, 233 Hollywood Road, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong
column37:
Led by artists Tang Kwok Hin and Samson Young, ‘Explore the Collection with Artists’ was one of the programmes during the recent ‘AAA Open Weekend.’ To accompany the tours, each artist created a series of artworks which are installed in different areas throughout the library. Video of the tours are available on the Collection Online.

Collecting Asia Art Archive Images ｜Tang Kwok Hin

Taking as a point of departure the multiple transformative processes that media undergoes nowadays, such as the possibility of retaking, downloading, and appropriating images, artist Tang Kwok Hin collected three kinds of images from the AAA book collection, including artists' portraits, sculptures, and photos of young boys, that he arranged to reflect three of his past works exploring themes of fictitiousness, media, and narrative. The three sets of newly created works, entitled Gathering Asian Artists at AAA, AAA Sculpture Collection Exhibition, and A Lost Family Member in AAA, are installed together with the three existing works in vacant spaces in the bookshelves throughout the library.

Alternative Archive of Asia Art Archive (AAAAA) ｜Samson Young

Artist Samson Young created an alternative archive within Asia Art Archive. He installed a number of fictional artifacts in various locations throughout the library. These artifacts probe the definition, physical boundaries, and temporal borders of archives. During the tours, Young switched between introducing the Archive's actual collection, and narrating the history and function of the fictional artifacts. Examples of the latter include dust and fibres collected from different book sections, the EEGs (brainwaves) of archivists that are being constantly logged and visualised with custom software, as well as tweets containing 'Ai Weiwei' monitored through the internet.

column19: “Tremble. Movement. Perception” The New Horizon of Taiwan New Media Art Exhibition
column20: 顫‧動‧感-台灣數位藝術新視野
column37: “Tremble, Movement, Perception” attempts to examine the relationship between technology and human perception. Chiu Chih-Yung, the curator of the exhibition, points to the curatorial concepts manifested by the three actions of the exhibition title: tremble refers to the “vibration and shaking directed by a certain perceptual mood”, while movement is “a non-static emotional response created by our own bodies or external forces”, and perception stands for an “emotional reaction, self-perception, or thoughts initiated by external stimulation”. Behind the notion of immediate mental and physical response to external impetus, there is something more serious: when technology is separated from its function, how does it develop its sensory and emotional influence over humans?
column38: 《顫‧動‧感》通過數位藝術，探索科技和人類感知之間的關係。策展人邱智勇闡釋展覽概念時指出，所謂「顫」，是「一種因有感知性的情態而產生的震動、發抖」、「動」是「經由自體或藉助外力而產生的非靜態反應」、「感」則是「某種受到外來刺激索引起的情緒反應, 或自我認知的看法/想法」。這些受外力刺激帶來的生理、心理的直接反應背後，是更深層的詰問：科技的功能性被排除後，如何透過身體對人產生感官和情感上的影響？此次展覽通過藝術的形式，使科技的使用價值暫時懸置，使觀眾從科技的包圍下抽身，真正反思其存在價值和本體論(ontological) －－ 即關於「存在」本身的哲學 －－ 狀態。

column37: ‘Arrivals’ is a site specific installation, created by Marco De Mutiis, as the result of his residency in Videotage. During the fuse:: artist-in-residence program, the artist developed an interest in the symptomatic disappearance of the neighboring Kai Tak old airport site. Kai Tak was home to Hong Kong International Airport until 1997, when the current Chek Lap Kok Airport took its place. The old site of Kai Tak airport is now being converted in a new site accommodating a new residential area, a cruise terminal and a subway station.
column38:
《抵達》是一件針對特定場域的裝置作品，由Marco De Mutiis創作，亦是他完成fuse:: 藝術家駐場計劃的成果展。駐留期間，Marco有感於已經消逝的香港舊啟德機場（其舊址恰恰位於錄影太奇所在的土瓜灣地區），並觸發是次創作。

啟德機場在1997年前曾為香港國際機場，其後才被赤臘角機場取替。時至今日，機場舊址已經啓動大型改建工程，包括興建新式住宅，郵輪碼頭和地下鐵路站。

Gallery 12, M/F, Convention Plaza, 1 Harbour Road, Wan Chai, Hong Kong
column10: ART ONE, 香港會議及展覽中心
column37:
<> is a series of 3 investigative video recordings where the artist immersed himself in three different uncomfortable situations resulting in an agonizing struggle of his senses against a metaphysical existence. In one of the videos, the artist was buried completely in
sand, attempting to battle against the forced element (earth) with his body. This
exploratory act would seem ambiguous to the audience awaiting for a conclusion or an
end. The work emphasizes the perceptual experience of both the art-making process and the outcome of the video. "My body, especially the organs related to the respiration system,involved in each of the processes as a medium/interface, to originate these scenes with a number of familiar elements, for instance milk, sand and water. My body here, as a perceiver individually, has been through an uncommon experience in the process, while getting another relatively different sensation/feeling from reviewing the outcome video at the same time.

Having focuses on the exploration of the concept of control the transient and the ephemeral, Marco du Mutiis shows our resistance to accept chaos and our obsessive impulse to control over the irrational and control of time. In video < NEGLECTED CHAOS [OBEY]> the skaters’ collective movement becomes an artificial order of lines and geometrical shapes under digital manipulation. Neglected chaos reveals as a visible order of harmony. <THE TRIAL> is a kinetic installation reflects on the idea of controlling time. Dates and numbers on the clock are replaced by text of Kafka’s <The Trial>. Regrets, memories and expectations…even we struggle to stop time, at least for a moment; we are forced to ‘obey’ time like the character of <The Trial>. 
http://www.marcodemutiis.com/
column38:
Marco近來把焦點放在控制慾上; 對於非理性的, 混沌的事物, 我們執迷於操控, 非要合理地找出內在的千絲萬縷不可。在錄像<潛混沌 [服從]>中，溜冰者的集體移動痕跡經過數位處理後，變為白線和幾何形狀，如此，被忽視的混亂狀況顯現成為可見的完美和諧秩序; 動能裝置<審判>反映控制時間這個概念，日期和數字被卡夫卡<審判>的文本取代。遺憾，回憶和期望…不期而遇，即使我們費多大的力氣掙扎，企圖停住時間，我們也被迫服從於時間之下，如<審判>中的人物一樣。
http://www.marcodemutiis.com/

column37:
HARDNECK.hk is pleased to present Undone, a solo exhibition by Hong Kong artist Ko Sin Tung, featuring her latest series of drawings and video installation works. 

Taking inspiration from the ubiquitous construction sites seen across Hong Kong, the exhibition explores the ambivalent notions of construction and progress within the contemporary context. In specific, Ko attempts to question the correlation between the individual motion and the movement of the whole; whether the act of constructing necessarily leads to the ideal collective goal, or does the condition of imperfection (construction site/exhibition space) ultimately become a static image and a reality throughout time. Further highlighting the tension between development and destruction, lurking around the exhibition is the disruption of pre-existing signs and images, connoting the inevitable collapse of order and structure.
column38:
HARDNECK.hk 呈獻香港藝術家高倩彤個展《Undone》，展出一系列最新繪畫與錄像裝置作品。

以香港隨處可見的地盤作起點，展覽探討在不同層面上，興建與進步之間所帶來的矛盾。當中，高氏亦對個人活動和群體方向兩者的關連發出提問︰興建這動作是否必定引領我們達至一個美好的共同目標？或是建設時的不完美狀態（地盤／展覽場地）已經變為一種靜止圖像甚至是一個現實？展覽內，不同標記與圖像被淆亂，不單展示著發展和破壞的張力，亦預示著本身存在的秩序與結構在建設時不能避免地瓦解的可能性。

column37: “The city is dying, you know?”  This famous line of a local drama has become a hot slogan in town, as well as the inspiration of the group exhibition organised by six Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art) students from a programme co-presented by Hong Kong Art School and RMIT University, Australia.  Through their artworks, the artists express their views on the metamorphosis of the city, and the difficulties the citizens encounter.
column38: 「This city is dying, you know?」這句電視劇的對白不但成為城中金句，亦成為六位正修讀由香港藝術學院及澳洲皇家墨爾本理工大學合辦的藝術文學士課程、主修繪畫的同學合辦是次聯展背後創作理念的出發點。他們透過作品表達對城市日漸都市化、人工化而產生蛻變的一些看法、置身其中的城市人面對的問題，以及何去何從。

column19: Is/Is Not Kai Tak River a Metaphor
column20: 啟德河是/不是一個隱喻
column35: Alessandro Carboni, David Halye, Ichi Ikeda, Yutaka Yano, Annie Wan, Chris Chan, Kingsley Ng, Chung Wai Ian, Lo Chi Kit
column37:
Kai Tak River is approximately 3 kilometers in length running through the old districts of Wong Tai Sin and Kowloon City in East Kowloon. Ten years ago or more, it was notorious for its stinky smell   and as other things in Hong Kong, it was seen but not cherished, it was ordinary but without face.  Now the nearby living space and ecological environments have been  changing drastically.  It stands there as a silent witness to all urban developments. The river is both the physical connection of geographies and the embodiment of the community's memory. When artists enter the environment, will turn it into a platform for playing imagination? Or to make a good intention come true?  Is it a temporal metaphor for the communal life? How do artists instill their imagination of the future or critical perspectives into the locale with their creativity?

Kai Tak River also  mirrors many aspects of Hong Kong's spatial development. The surrounding fresco of schools, communities, housing estates, parks and major transportation routes sums up and reflects the life of old communities. Isn't its variety a metaphor for the constant transformation of local communities, and the future development of green lifestyle? As the artists enter the green environment to connect art with education--Is this just a story about symbols, or a source of artistic power that inspires, acts and opens up the public imagination and dialogue?

「油麻地剩食圖鑑展覽」除了派發圖鑑，參與學生更會通過各種媒介，發掘剩食與藝術創作之間的種種關係，不但以創作紀錄和探討剩食問題，甚至直接以剩食作為創作物料。展覽希望邀請區內區外的街坊齊齊思考剩食議題，並在日常生活中減少剩食的產生。Participating organization:

column38:
“Yau Ma Tei Leftover Guide Exhibition” would be a platform to distribute the Guide, and at the same time exhibit the works of participating students.They explore the connection between leftover food and visual arts with a variety of media to record and disucss leftover food issue, as well as explore the possiblities to use leftover food as material. The exhibition would like to invite audiences from different neighborhoods to rethink the issue and reduce food waste in daily life.參與單位：

column37: iPreciation Hong Kong is proud to present a group exhibition of four Hong Kong local artists- Tse Yim On, Hung Keung, Ho Yuen Leung and Au Ka Wai, featuring their latest creations done between 2011 to 2012. Graduated from the Fine Arts Department of The Chinese University of Hong Kong, the arts education in college years were an enlightening experience to all four of them. Each individual later developed artworks that penetrate a variety of issues and themes. This time four of them join hands once again for the current exhibition, engage in four distinct media in conveying their yearning for the good old days before radical changes took place in their hometown.

column9: White Cube Hong Kong 50 Connaught Road Central
column37:
White Cube Hong Kong is pleased to announce an exhibition of new work by Elad Lassry, his second with the gallery. Over the past few years, through photographs, films and sculpture, as well as interventions in the gallery space, Lassry has developed a reputation for the wit and rigour of his investigations into how we perceive and conceive pictures. In Hong Kong, Lassry will present a varied body of new work, including pictures, sculptures and a drawing, as well as perversely hybrid objects that radically question the distinction between these media.

For Lassry, the act of looking, whether at a unique artwork, human face or generic coffee cup, is always a picture-making process, an instant that combines a particular sensual experience haunted by the memory of countless images that transform that experience. Brown, Red, Blue (2012) appears to be a picture of a sculpture, but the picture itself, in the form of the dominant hue, overflows and becomes inseparable from the sculptural frame. The picture has its own mysteries, seemingly a depiction of a scientific model of what looks like an organic substance breeding or multiplying. The artist’s sculpture, likewise, often flirts with the possibility that it is, instead, a picture. Untitled (Zebrawood Picture, Taupe) (2012) has a manifestly sculptural presence, with biomorphic shapes that bring to mind a relief by Jean Arp, and yet the scale perfectly reflects that of one of Lassry’s pictures. The work asserts itself as a sculpture while it hangs almost flat on the wall, with only one side visible to the viewer. Does the wood background act as a support or frame to the forms it presents, or is it integral to the artwork? Is it a still life or an abstraction, or both? These questions are further explored in Boston Shoulder Roasts (2012). Two palpable slabs of meat sit in a clean, clinical space. Behind them, two colour swatches suggest at once monochrome abstractions and a system for measuring colour. Framed in a fleshy red, the combination of specific, organic object, and a kind of distillation of its formal properties, creates a space in which we feel a tension between embodied experience and a set of abstract thoughts evoked by that experience. Within these spaces created by Lassry’s pictures and sculptures, a vibrant corporeality and a simultaneous longing for pure knowledge are suspended together in the pleasurable apprehension of the art object.
column38:
香港白立方即將第二度為 Elad Lassry 舉行展覽。過去數年，透過照片、影像和雕塑，以及在畫廊空間內製作的裝置， Elad Lassry在其作品中所表現出來的機智和嚴謹性在藝術界是享負盛名的。是次在香港展出最新的作品包括圖片、雕塑和畫像，以及混合性作品，從根本上質疑這些媒體之間的區別。

對 Elad Lassry而言，「觀看」這種行為，不論實踐在一個獨特的藝術品、人臉或一般的咖啡杯，都是一個圖片的創作過程，一個瞬間的記憶縈繞著無數圖像轉換的經驗，結合了特定的感官體驗。棕色、紅色、藍色（2012年）是一個雕塑的圖片，圖片本身的主色調、溢出的形式，在雕塑框架中分開不了。圖片既有其自身的奧秘，描繪的似乎是科學模型的樣子，或是有機物質的培植或繁洐。同樣，Elad Lassry 的雕塑經常呈現在圖片中調和出多樣的可能性。在無題（斑馬圖片，灰褐色）（2012年）一作中，明顯一個生物形態的雕塑，令人聯想到法國雕塑家兼畫家Jean Arp的作品，卻完美體現於 Elad Lassry 的圖片中。作品體現的形態是雕塑，然而它掛在牆上，只有一面給觀眾看到。究竟木材的背景支撐或錶幀著這個表現模式，抑或木材的背景本身就是藝術品的一部分呢？它是一個靜止的生物或是抽象的物體，或是兩者並全？在波士頓肩膊的烘烤（2012年）中，再一次對這些問題作進一步的探討。兩件肉塊一同坐在一個乾淨的、客觀的空間上，在它們的身後，有兩組顏色咭紙以單一色調的抽象物組成顏色測量系統。規範在鮮紅的、具體而有組織的物體之上，在正統對象蒸發後，我們感受到作品之體現及一組抽象思維誘發的經驗之間的緊張關係。在 Elad Lassry 創作的圖片和雕塑之中塑造的空間，盛載著一個充滿活力的形體，以及對純知識的渴望，充滿愉悅的憂慮懸浮在藝術作品之上。

column19: “2012 Outstanding Graduation Exhibition” by Visual Communication Department, Tsinghua University
column20: 清華大學美術學院視覺傳達系「2012本科畢業設計優秀作品展」
column37: Graduates from the Department of Visual Communication from Tsinghua University’s Academy of Arts & Design decided to bid farewell to their school and teachers with creative works inspired by their true feelings. To share the fruits of labour of these budding talents, K11 is bringing a selection of works by 6 of the graduates to Hong Kong. In particular, the works by K11’s star artist Shi Shuo are definitely not to be missed.
column38: 是次清華大學美術學院2012本科生畢業展覽中，視覺傳達系的畢業生決心以感性作其創意出發點，為他們學校和教師來個宏偉的告別儀式。為了能讓香港民眾和我們分享這些畢業生的努力成果，K11特別挑選了視覺傳達設計系的六位同學的作品來香港展出，其中不容錯過 K11 創意新星，新進設計師石碩的作品。

column20: 三位藝體」亞洲青年創作展
column37: “Trinity”, this year’s APPortfolio exhibition is a collection of 33 pieces of works from 3 lands, by artists aged under 35, showcasing the best in interactive and innovative installations. The key visuals of the exhibition are symbolic animals from the three lands, namely the sparrow from Hong Kong, the spotted deer from Taiwan, and the cuddly panda from mainland China.
column38: 由 APPortfolio (亞洲青年創作平台) 主辦的一年一度的亞洲青年創作展，「三位藝體」彙集兩岸三地 35 歲以下年輕藝術家和設計師的33件藝術佳作，展現了互動與創新裝置藝術的最高水準。展覽最關鍵的視覺標識為這三個地區的代表動物，即來自香港的麻雀、來自台灣的梅花鹿和來自中國大陸的可愛大熊貓。

column37:
John Cage is one of the most influential figures in contemporary art history. Soundtracking #John Cage 4’33” takes the chance to celebrate his centennial by re-thinking his most famous and controversial composition 4’33” in the current collaborative digital era.
Fourteen talents whose expertise lies in different fields are invited to reinvent a new 4’33” through collaborating with each other through the Media Wiki platform. The Media Wiki project is a constant expanding, evolving and open ended project where the spirit of sharing and collaborating are emphasized. With the actual engagement of the artists and the general public, new generated versions of 4’33” will be exhibited and performed together as part of Videotage’s Wikitopia Festival.
Videotage is a leading non‐profit organisation in facilitating, promoting and presenting new media art in Hong Kong. Since 1986, Videotage has developed itself from an umbrella for media artists to a media art and culture network for cross‐disciplinary cultural productions and international exchange of ideas and knowledge.
column38:
John Cage 是當代藝術史上其中一位最具代表性的大師。為紀念其出生一百週年，Soundtracking #John Cage以今日數碼互動時代的角度重新思考他最為人認識及最具爭議性的作品4’33”。
十四位來自不同領域的藝術家，以彼此不同的知識與經驗，在講求分享和合作的Media Wiki平台互相沖激，共同重新創造新版本的4’33”。實驗成果將會以展覽及表演結合成參與集體創作，作為錄映太奇舉辦的維基托邦未來文化祭其中一個項目。
Soundtracking #John Cage 4’33” 乃錄映太奇舉辦的維基托邦未來文化祭其中一個項目。錄映太奇為香港非牟利藝術團體。自一九八六年成立以來，以推廣、創造及保存錄像和媒體藝術為旨，為媒體藝術工作者提供科技、藝術及文化網絡，是本土媒體藝術的先鋒。錄映太奇從最初以媒體藝術家集結點，日漸發展成一個媒體藝術與文化的多元網絡，為媒體藝術家提供一個國際性及跨範疇的藝術創作和交流平台。

column19: Le French May 2012- Transporting QI by Cecilia Ho Exhibition
column37:
Commenced as a collective performance, hundreds of people blow their Qi (energy) into balloons which are then transported 2,000 km away to rural Yunnan. During the ten day voyage, the Artist uses this absurd happening of ‘Transporting Qi’ to provoke people – that turns into a subject of occasions, conversation, participation, collection and at times illusion. At destination in Yuanyang , village children receive the Qi and enact another performance of its release from the balloons. Photographs, video and writings are used for documenting this voyage.

More information on Le French May 2012 official website:
http://frenchmay.com/event/transporting-qi-cecilia-ho

Cecilia Ho website:
http://www.hocecilia.com/
column38: 集腋成「球」，數百人把他們的氣收集於多個紅色氣球內， 運送到2000公里外的云南省。在十天的旅途上，藝術家以「收集及運送人氣」的怪現象觸發觀眾思維，並展開對話及互動交流。在最終目的地—元陽大型梯田上，農村孩子們一起把氣球擠破，將收集的氣釋放到完全不同的世界。這故事以攝影、錄像及文字形式表達，重新展示觀眾眼前。

column37:
HARDNECK.hk presents Artist Fee, a project by Hong Kong conceptual artist LAM Hoi Sin. The concept shop runs a waste-utilising cause and generates its own funds, the project welcomes donations of second-hand and spare items. Things are gathered and redistributed as giveaways and recycled goods, whilst some are used for artwork production. The title suggests how the artist makes her living and play up the fact that artists in Hong Kong rarely get a fee for their labour.

As an experimental platform, Artist Fee is ending after three months of stationing in Foo Tak Building. The closing exhibition, subtitled as “The Crap Show”, will display Lam’s work-in-progress primarily made from donated materials. Consisting mainly of ready-mades and altered objects, the exhibition will be a semi-parody of the contemporary art scene as presented in the media, revolving around unique, mishaps, mass-produced kitsch and found images. “Crap” is a literal theme for the contents that are made from waste; ironically it is what some may consider as the face of contemporary art now.
column38:
HARDNECK.hk 正在舉行一個由本地概念藝術家林愷倩創作，名為Artist Fee的藝術企劃。整個企劃源自對一間廢物利用概念店的構想，店舖售賣的都是別人捐贈的二手舊物 ，甚至是垃圾。店主將收集得來的舊物或廢物重新整理，或贈送他人，或回收，或循環再造成為藝術創作的一部份。企劃的標題貼切地表達出她如何賺取生活費，更 俏皮地道出作為本地藝術家難以依賴展覽收入的苦況。

屬於試驗性質的Artist Fee在富德樓進行了三個月後來到尾聲，閉幕展將命名為《垃圾展》，並會展出林愷倩用舊物製成的作品。她以現成的物件作為主要的材料，加以改變它們的形 狀、外貌、又採用大批既重覆又庸俗的圖像，以半諷刺的手法去嘲弄當代藝術在大眾媒體眼中的角色。正因為作品都是用旁人眼中的垃圾所製成，「垃圾」自然就成 為閉幕展的題目。諷刺地，這也正正是很多人心目中對當代藝術的看法。

column20: 心塵: 五位中國女性藝術家群展
column35: Xiao Lu, Juju Sun, He Chengyao, Cui Xiuwen and Cai Jin
column37:
Family backgrounds are pivotal to a person’s upbringing and life journey – a fact evident in many artists’ works – and shapes a person’s reasoning, artistic touch and ways of expression. The latest Pearl Lam Galleries exhibition, titled Dust from the Heart, explores the mixed perspectives on life and Chinese history vicariously through the journey of five Chinese contemporary female artists, each with distinct backgrounds. Xiao Lu, Juju Sun, He Chengyao, Cui Xiuwen and Cai Jin will exhibit a range of paintings, videos, photographs and installations as spoken accounts of their lives.

The exhibition aims to visit the complicated history of women in China warped in political and cultural realities. The works will demonstrate, in their own manner, how female artists are willing to openly put forward their personal sensibilities and experiences.

column37: Taking Off makes use of the elevation and linearity of the footbridge, and applies the image of an airplane runway to create the atmosphere of an airplane taking off.  The setting is best experienced when viewing through the clear window from the Hong Kong Arts Centre.  The elevated runway looks as if floating above the greeneries and poetically vanishes towards the sky behind.
column38: 《起飛》沿用天橋的長度及架空性，將飛機跑道的圖像拼貼在其上蓋，塑造出一個飛機起飛的景象。由香港藝術中心的玻璃窗幕眺望，彷彿置身於候機大堂，是觀賞該藝術作品的最佳位置。長長的跑道好像被兩旁的綠葉承托著，詩意地消失於天空中。

column37: Nathalie Decoster tells the tale of man’s relationship with time through simple lines and a careful balance of shapes.  Her work is natural and composed.  The contrast between the tiny figures and the giant symbols creates a feeling of infinity that invites us to meditation and slowness.

column37: CONTEMPORARY BY ANGELA LI is proud to present Deconstruction, an exhibition of three artists from around the world who play with the use of different materials, achieving fascinating results in the finished artwork. Each of these artists painstakingly spends hours to create their artwork using carving knives, drills or their bare hands. The results are stunning visual effects with different social and political meanings or reflections of these artists’ current states of mind.

column20: 于逸堯／呂時鵬 平面影像作品 “睇咗當食咗”
column37: An exhibition of photo-graphic-images by Yu Yat-yiu and Pang Pang Lu. Exotic dishes stimulate a desire to eat as a substitute for sex. From the art photos of Yu Yat Yiu and Visual Arts of PangPang Lu, it’s an exhibition of food porn that presents food and art provocatively.
column38:
食物照片是新的色情圖像。今天，我們吃飯都是先餵手機相機再餵肚皮。 
于逸堯／呂時鵬扭曲視覺，提鍊 food porn，玩味 “睇咗當食咗” 精神。

column19: "The Obscure Desire of Objects" An exhibition by Chow Yiu Fai and his students(Yvette Wong, Sui Swii Lam, Beryl Foo, Jeska Chau, Arlai Ho-lun Chio) based on recreations of this lyrical works
column20: "迷糊。情欲。對象。 周耀輝與80/90後 跨時空媒體性別展
column35: Chow Yiu Fai and his students ( Yvette Wong, Sui Swii Lam, Beryl Foo, Jeska Chau, Arlai Ho-lun Chio )
column37:
This exhibition started with three wishes.
I wish to see something usually not visible in our city. I wish to create and re-create. I wish we were living in a better world.
I invited Yvette, Sui, Beryl, Jeska and Lun, all born in the 80s/90s, to join me. I also invited transgender activist Joanne Leung and transgender sex worker Kei Kei to participate in some of the works. Inspired by a selection of my lyrical works, the exhibition explores issues of words and the city, body and sexuality, boundaries and porosities, ultimately to pay tribute to the obscure desire, of objects.
column38:
展覽是從三個希望開始的。
我希望看到平常在城裡看不到的。我希望創作創作創作。我希望我們活在更美好的世界裡。
因此我找來王樂儀，林淼，Beryl，Jeska，錀等幾個80/90後和我一起探索，也找來跨性別維權人士梁詠恩和跨性別性工作者琦琦參與部分作品，以我的歌詞為對象，試圖呈現文字與城市，性別與情欲，界限與滲透之間的種種迷糊。
[展品收益捐贈跨性別資源中心，及性工作者權益組織紫藤]

column20: 《一紙十樣》插畫及裝置巡迴展 (新作+精選)
column36:
黎達達榮、利志達 、Leumas To  、神野猫 、 劉思 、
Benny Au、貓室、馮穎琪 、Michaelmichaelmichael、夏至
column38:
《一紙十樣》創作人簡介


黎達達榮
獨立漫畫家、跨媒體創作人，從事漫畫創作17年，漫畫作品在香港、台灣、日本及法國皆有發行。從首部個人漫畫作品《慢慢豬‧凸凸交》起，出版作品有《木積積‧中中值》、《動物園台灣出巡》、《咆哮脂肪》、《港島線》、《龍虎門徒》、《東宮西宮》及《il y a 2600 ans》等。2008及2011年，兩度應邀出席法國安古蘭國際漫畫節。

利志達
獨立漫畫家、設計師，從事漫畫創作30年，曾加入玉郎機構、斯辰出版社。1984年發表《衛斯理》系列漫畫，1987年自資出版《同門少年》，重要作品包括《刺秦》、《天妖記》、《SUPERBABY》等。作品《POSH！少年隊》、《陳小姐》、《我的國》等曾於日本雜誌發表，亦應邀參加日本《COMIC IN ASIA》巡迴漫畫展覽。同期為江戶川亂步小說繪成短篇《鏡地獄》。近年創作多樣化，商業插畫及設計客戶包括NIKE、海洋公園、港鐵龍年生肖紀念票等。


Leumas To
插畫師、平面設計師。2009年獲「Vivienne Westwood宣言創意比賽」冠軍，曾參展香港設計中心「書法．設計 - 海報及創作展覽」。2011年，舉辦個人插畫展《我們都是浪漫的好孩子》及《我們跳著浪漫的圓舞曲》。今年，先後策劃和參與創作《一紙五樣》及《一紙十樣》插畫及裝置聯展。並將於11月在深圳華僑城創意園舉辦首個內地個展《一起迷失在南山的森秋》。


神野猫
裝置藝術家，2007年開始創作紙品藝術，2009年紙糊作品「神野犬」首次公開展覽，2010年獲LCX贊助舉行大型個展，2011年為LCX繪畫以「BLOSSOM AND FORTUNE」為主題的兔年年畫及利是封。同年，將來自柏林的DISPATCHWORK引入香港，創辦「DISPATCHERS WORLDWIDE IN HK」，用塑膠積木修補香港歷史建築。2012年，與日本著名設計團隊GROOVISIONS合作，為CHAPPIE度身訂造《花幹掉那女孩》紙糊衣裳。並獲德國ART INVESTOR邀請成為旗下合作藝術家。


劉思
空間設計師，生於北京，在武漢長大，先後於兩地讀書。主修建築，副修日語，期間曾於土耳其及挪威短暫工作和學習。大學畢業後獲得DAAD藝術家獎學金，前往德國柏林主修舞台設計。2011年加入進念．二十面體，參與舞台及展覽設計工作。喜歡旅行及閱讀，從未停下以畫筆描繪看到的世界。


Benny Au
平面設計師，Amazing Angle Design 設計總監，Amazing Twins 原創人之一。九十年代將其設計帶到日本，於東京、大阪等地展出，並與新力及日立合作，發展原創產品系列及廣告製作。除專注於平面及字體設計工作外，更於工作坊開設miniminigallery， 致力策劃有關設計、攝影和書籍的展覽及座談會，其中大型設計活動包括「SEVEN ﹣日本頂尖美術指導展」、「日本東京字體指導協會展在香港」、「東京設計週2007 Love from Hong Kong 展覽」及「深圳香港設計邀請展」。 作品除被國際多間美術館收藏，亦屢獲香港及海外設計獎項， 2008年當選「香港十大傑出設計師」。


貓室
二人繪本、動畫組合，作品《癲噹》於日本放送電視台播出，曾獲「香港國際電影節」選為「超人氣動畫」播映，作品《姓旦老人》曾於日本TBS電視台獲頒最高殊榮，其後作者受「藝術發展局」頒發「年度最佳藝術家」，繪本《癲噹》於三聯出版。


馮穎琪
作曲人、填詞人、創作歌手，1996年展開音樂創作，憑創作鄭秀文主唱的《放不低》而聞名，至今出版過的曲、詞作品已超過一百首。2005年憑《雌雄同體》奪得「CASH金帆音樂獎最佳另類歌曲」殊榮。2007年與音樂人藍奕邦、金培達等創立 Backstage Live Restaurant，積極推動本地現場音樂文化，2010年跟音樂人謝國維合組「音樂份子有限公司」，建立錄音室及製作團隊，並發掘優秀的創作人。近年參與作品包括《Wanna Be》、《今天終於一人回家》、《彳亍》、《弱水三千》、《夢非夢》等。


Michaelmichaelmichael
跨媒體創作人。畢業於加拿大 Emily Carr University of Art and Design，主修攝影及平面設計。HAJI Gallery，獨立雜誌 PRESS MINI，媒體 HAJI TV 創辦人。曾任職商業電台，電視廣播有限公司，電訊盈科。從事演唱會製作，舞台劇、跨媒體內容製作，網站製作，廣告製作，美術指導，攝影，電視節目導演、監製，平面設計，與及藝術行政和管理。


Mini 夏至
跨媒體創作人，HAJI Gallery、獨立雜誌《PRESS MINI》及媒體 HAJI TV 創辦人。曾於主流媒體任職，包括商業電台內容策劃、國際音樂總監、節目監製及主持；參與 TVB Music 宣傳及造型，TVB節目設計及主持；NOW TV 節目內容供應，節目導演、監製及主持。Mini 同時為音樂製作人、小說及專欄作家及作詞人，至今詞作超過三百首。

column19: " Seasonal by HK Farm " Group exhibition with HK Farm (Michael Leung, Matthew Edmondson, and Glenn Eugen Ellingsen)
column35: Michael Leung, Matthew Ecmondson, Glenn Eugen Ellingsen
column37:
HK Farm was created by a designer, archivist and photographer in March 2012. These creative backgrounds have influenced an urban agricultural direction that is honest, unpredictable, tangible and self-sufficient.

Their work is multidisciplinary, environmentally-charged and contextual to Hong Kong's urban environment. Similar to the crops grown on their rooftop and fertilised by resources found in the city, they work in a challenging environment - drawing their inspiration from the city and the communities they live in.

This October, Hong Kong gradually transitioned from its hot and wet season into its cool and optimal peak farming season. Parallel to sowing their seeds, HK Farm captured this transition on their rooftop farm in a series of mixed media artworks.

Seasonal by HK Farm is an exhibition that displays the relationship between their creative work and the seasons, and aims to highlight the importance in growing locally and eating seasonally.

column9: White Cube Hong Kong 50 Connaught Road Central
column19: Grace to be born and live as variously as possible…
column37:
Wyn Evans' conceptual practice incorporates a wide range of media including installation, sculpture, photography, film and works on paper. For this exhibition, the artist used an inscription from the tombstone of American poet and writer Frank O'Hara as the title and inspiration of his exhibition. The inscription reads: ‘Grace to be born and live as variously as possible’, a tender and celebratory epitaph, which could equally be considered as a subtitle to everyday life, evoking a desire to be open to possibilities and alternative adventures.

In the first floor gallery, Wyn Evans installed a group of four, new, crystal chandeliers that created a sense of theatrical occasion and an infinite world of interpretations. Clustered together, the chandeliers seem to be 'breathing' since their lights flicker on and off in different pulses. Each chandelier has been orchestrated to react to the beat of a particular piece of music such as Gimme Shelter (1969) by The Rolling Stones or Mahler’s Symphony No. 5 (Adagio) (1902), turning these once decorative objects into phenomenological machines; a choir of different personalities and rhythms. The chandeliers create their own mellifluous language that suggests a fantastical structure of communication with intimations of an otherworldly presence or an improbable séance.

Wyn Evans frequently includes quotations from iconic literary sources in his work as raw material for future thought or as a way to reinvigorate original ideas. In the second floor gallery, a large neon text sprawls across the gallery, spelling out the phrase: ‘Things are conspicuous in their absence…’. The text points to the ability of language to create moments of rupture and delight, where romantic longing, desire and reality conjoin and invite us to pay attention to the absence of things, to the emptiness between objects, words or thoughts. In the corner of the gallery, alongside the neon, three potted plants, indigenous to Hong Kong, slowly revolved on three turntables. Plant Revolution (2012) added an element of nature to the exhibition, exploring ideas of spatial intervention through a different kind of non-technological material. Movement is translated through the plants, turning them into intangible objects that are both sculptural, real and prop-like at the same time.
column38:
香港白立方隆重呈獻首次與畫廊合作的藝術家Cerith Wyn Evans展覽。Wyn Evans的概念藝術實踐涉及多種媒介，其中包括裝置、雕塑、攝影、錄像以及紙上作品。此次展覽的主題源自Wyn Evans受到美國詩人兼作家Frank O'Hara 篆刻在其墓碑上的碑文的啓發，碑文這樣寫到：「讓獲恩賜的生命活得精彩」(‘Grace to be born and live as variously as possible’) 。一個用上如此柔和字句的墓誌銘當可被視為日常生活的一種寫照，它喚醒了那種人們對生活上各種事情的渴望，以及勇於嘗試的冒險精神。

為了營造劇場的氛圍以及對無限世界的詮釋，Wyn Evans在畫廊一樓安裝了四組全新水晶吊燈。集結在一起的吊燈，其閃爍的燈光像脈搏般若隱若現，感覺猶如「呼吸」一樣。每一組吊燈都經過精心的佈置，響應特定的音樂節拍 ─ 例如滾石樂隊的《Gimme Shelter》（1969）或馬勒第五交響曲（慢拍）（1902），並將原本只作裝飾物之用的吊燈變成現象學的載體，構成一個兼具各種風格和韻律的合唱團。吊燈創造了一套自身的通暢語言及交流系統，暗示來世的存在或未可知的精神交流。

Wyn Evans在他的作品中常常引用著名文學作品的文字作為其對於未來思考的根本；透過文學作品，Wyn Evans亦同時改進自己的一些個人想法。在畫廊的二樓，大型的霓虹燈文字遍佈整個畫廊空間，文字寫到：「事物正因為它們的不存在而更為突出…」，並指出語言具備製造破壞和喜悅時刻的功能，浪漫的渴望和慾望與現實在其中互相交錯，令我們開始關注事物的不存在，以及物體、文字或思緒之間的虛無。在畫廊角落的霓虹燈旁邊，放置了三株產於香港的盆栽，圍繞著轉盤緩慢地旋轉。 Plant Revolution (2012)為此次展覽增添了自然的元素，通過各類型的非科技材料，探索空間的干預概念。由植物中轉化而來的「運動」亦反過來將植物變成無形的、同時是真實的、像雕刻和道具般的物體。

column36: 樂群會員, 嘉諾撒聖心書院學生
column37: Home is synonymous with comfort and warmth, everyone has unique and wonderful memories, as well as feelings, towards home. The artworks in ‘Stay Home with Dreams’ art installation exhibition are co-created by the members with intellectual disability from TWGHs Lok Kwan District Support Centre and the students of Sacred Heart Canossian College, in which they drew their ideal homes together on hundred pieces of transparency. Their painting themes include family and pets, daily routine, home furnishings and home environment. Under the refraction of light, different colors from transparency converge, showing the jigsaw effect and inclusion between the members of TWGHs LKDSC and students of SHCC, and bonds between them are established through art.
column38: 家是安逸和溫暖的代名詞，每一個人對家都有著獨特、美好的記憶及感受。這次「家．夢想」計劃就聯合了樂群地區支援中心和嘉諾撒聖心書院的學生，一起畫出自己理想的家，其中就包括家人寵物、家常便飯、家內擺設、屋外環境等四方面。上百塊的膠片作品在燈光的折射下，各種色彩互相融合，寓意參加的樂群會員及聖心同學互補長短，藉藝術拉近人於人之間的距離。

column37:
HARDNECK.hk and Observation Society are pleased to present “seven gentlemen” a solo exhibition by Trevor Yeung.

Yeung is a horticulture and aquarium enthusiast. Such hobbies, that are usually associated with men in their golden age, require an appreciation for slow processes, a preference for systematization, and aptly reflect the artist’s approach to his art. On the surface of his recent installations with pot plants, pristine glass tanks and water systems lies rationality and beauty, but upon further study, this itch for cultivating little worlds and ecosystems reveals an appetite for control and gentle domination.Breaking away from the typical sterile mode of presentation, “seven gentlemen” invites the audience to delve into Yeung’s meticulously composed biosphere and engage with the chaos within; much like approaching a dance floor rammed with a potpourri of weirdos.
column38:
HARDNECK.hk與觀察社呈獻香港藝術家楊沛鏗個展《七位先生》。

楊沛鏗喜愛種盆栽、喜愛養魚和佈置魚缸。他有像孤獨老人打發花不光的時間才不得不有的一些嗜好，然而，觀眾卻往往從那裡找到理解他藝術創作的線索︰而這些興趣，反映出他對緩慢的過程和井然有序的系統的偏好，人們或許會以為這位藝術家只是崇尚理性，喜歡的是秩序的美，但事實不止如此。藝術家是透過掌握這些小系統－一個個細小的世界，而著迷於控制的感覺，一種溫和的主宰。楊氏的前幾個作品都跟這些嗜好息息相關︰觀眾能看到盆栽、水池和喉管，它們呈現出怪異而美麗的形態，但它們卻又像正兒八經的藝術品那樣，與觀者保持距離，不容他們去擾亂。在《七位先生》這一作品中，他讓觀眾進入他精心設定的系統中，並讓他們看到系統平靜乾淨的外表裡是何等的亂墜天花，簡直像個擠滿了各式各樣怪人的舞池。

column9: 1st Floor, 18 Wing Fung Street, Wanchai, Hong Kong
column37:
There are few creative fields that have such a richly rewarding friendship as the visual arts and music. Why indeed should we choose between Elvis and Duchamp? Some artists never decide and instead develop a sort of double practice.

Through this global and multidisciplinary approach she proposes to understand the projects of the 18 artist-musicians (or musician-artists) from a double point of view – visual and musical. This way we can better see their impact, better measure their diversity and individuality, and better understand what separates them from other contemporary art and music scenes. 

Being Head of Art & Culture of the agnès b. Endowment Fund, Jean-François Sanz, the curator of the exhibition, brings this project to Hong Kong with a touch of 2 local artists, GayBird and Henry Chu. Apart from displaying their artworks in the exhibition, the 2 new media artists also gave a mini multimedia music performance during the opening cocktail.

column35: Lee Wai-chun, Lee Chi-ching, Wong Chiu-tat
column37:
The Central Market will undergo conservation and revitalisation in hopes of improving the air quality in the district and providing an additional leisure cum entertaining place rarely found in this busy district. It will become a new hang-out area for white collar workers in the daytime and locals and tourists in the evenings and on the weekends.

The Urban Renewal Authority and Public Art Hong Kong are collaborating with three acclaimed local comic artists: Lee Wai-chun, Lee Chi-ching, and Wong Chiu-tat, to renew the exterior marquee of the Central Market. The collaboration introduces an array of beguiling comic elements in diverse styles onto the marquee, resonating with a harmonious and relaxing atmosphere in the hustle and bustle of city life.
column38: 中環街市將進行保育和活化，改善中區的空氣質素，在鬧市中創造一個難得的休閒點，成為上班人士在日間、市民和遊客在晚上和周末的新休閒去處。市區重建局與香港公共藝術合作，邀請了三位著名本土漫畫家李惠珍、李志清及黃照達，透過更新罩幕，為街市外牆加入漫畫元素，以不同風格的作品，為這繁忙的城市生活加添悠閒、和諧的氣氛。

column19: Art Habitat- a brand new of experience collecting and displaying art at home
column20: 蝸居藏藝 ─ 在家收藏藝術的新體驗
column29: Hong Kong Arts Centre, Hong Kong Art School
column30: 香港藝術中心、香港藝術學院
column37: Art and culture always go hand in hand with our daily life. The literati used to collect calligraphy, paintings and art objects in the past; now we collect comic books, films and limited edition furniture. Art appreciation is an essential part of collecting art. The Hong Kong Arts Centre is now bringing art out of the museum, into the homes of many. ‘Art Habitat’ is a collaborative project between the Centre and the Hong Kong Art School, aiming to study and encourage art collecting. The rental scheme benefits individuals with short term art loans, by putting art in a brand new context- each ‘adopted art work’ is to able to dwell in a domestic environment. Photography, painting and ceramic art work will be provided by graduates and current students from the Hong Kong Art School, to be loaned by the public. Hong Kong Arts Center is setting up a display on the second floor to introduce the scheme and loan art pieces, which will serve as an active gesture to encourage the public to experience art in a domestic environment.
column38: 藝術與文化其實與生活緊貼，昔日古人會在書室收藏字畫古玩，而今有絕版漫畫、電影、限量家具的收藏家，可見藝術觀賞與收藏本來息息相關。藝術中心希望將藝術品從展覽館帶入尋常百姓家，於是舉辦「藝術品寄養計劃」。本計劃是香港藝術中心及其屬下的香港藝術學院合作項目，希望藉以鼓勵和研究大衆收藏文化。本計劃一方面以租借方式享受數週藝術收藏的樂趣，另一方面讓藝術品突破展覽局限，藉「寄養」把藝術品帶入居室，展開另一展覽歷程。本計劃將由香港藝術學院的畢業生和學生提供各式攝影、繪畫和陶瓷等藝術品，供公眾租借，租借者既能租借藝術品。為配合本計劃，藝術中心將於二樓設有展示空間，介紹這計劃及出租藝術品，讓大眾體會在斗室之內收藏藝術品的趣味。

column35: Santi Capo, Manuel Cuellar Joyas, Nuria Deya, Gemma Lopez, Grikkia
column37:
Hong Kong May 2012 – AME Gallery is proud to present a Spanish Contemporary Jewellery Exhibition, for the first time featuring a collection of Mediterranean inspired handcrafted rings, pendants and earrings designed by 5 renowned Spanish artists. The collection will offer designs from award winning artists including Núria Deyà who specializes in bringing sights of her native surroundings such as the blue sea, the island trees, the sky and Spanish architecture to her work.

Santi Capó perfects his designs with subtlety by using traditional yet innovative techniques. His designs often remind one of contemporary sculpture with a hint of the Mediterranean Sea.

Manuel Cuellar Joyas has been designing jewellery for 16 years. He likes to mix gold and silver with gemstones such as tourmalines, opals and corals, showing true traditional Spanish craftsmanship to finish in their unique forms.

Following her family members’ footsteps as jewellery designers, Gemma López from Barcelona, has also made her way up as a reputable artist and jewellery designer. Her creations often have nature inspired Mediterranean motif. 

Designs from Frikkia will also be on display featuring 2 artists who are known for their ever-changing styles.

Anna Cheng, Ame Gallery’s curator said: “We are excited to introduce Spanish contemporary jewellery to Hong Kong. The collection is a true reflection of the artists’ enduring fascination with ecological and architectural beauty, and their pride in their heritage. I hope one will truly get a taste of the Mediterranean by coming to this exhibition.“

column9: AME Gallery, 12/F Tin On Shing Commercial Building, 41-43 Graham St., Central Hong Kong
column19: Art in Motion- contemporary jewellery exhibiiton of Yael Sonia
column37:
AME Gallery is proud to present the exhibition of Yael Sonia’s jewellery, a showcase of her work in Asia for the first time.

Inspired by children’s toys and a child’s expression when fascinated by an exciting new toy, this kinetic jewellery is comprised of rolling spheres, swinging pendulums and spinning tops. It’s jewellery that comes alive with its wearer as the melodic sounds are perpetually emitted when the fine gemstones and pearls meet the art of handcrafted 18K gold structures

Yael Sonia’s creations are timeless. Her ingenious designs have gained her public acclaim and international awards. In 2002, Yael won the Tahitian Pearl Trophy Award for her “Spinning Wheel” necklace from the Perpetual Motion Collection. Yael Sonia’s art jewellery has been featured in world-renowned shows and galleries in the United Kingdom, the United States, Brazil, Germany, France, Spain and Switzerland.

column9: Gallery by the Harbour, Shop 207, Level 2, Ocean Centre, Harbour City, Tsimshatsui
column20: 德國寧芬堡皇室瓷器及首飾展@海港城‧美術館
column37: Gallery by the Harbour and Galerie Huit is proud to present the Nymphenburg Porcelain & Jewelry Exhibition at Gallery by the Harbour from 30 Nov to 17 Dec, 2012.Nymphenburg jewelry and tableware in traditional fine German porcelain - the solution for all your Christmas gifts. Delicately designed by Patrick Muff in white, black and coral shades, Nymphenburg jewelry is worn day or night by men and women. Personifying  'elegance with a twist', it's daringly different, with pendants in skulls, anchors, wings and stars, set in precious metals, enhanced with gemstones. Historic pieces from the 250-year old Nymphenburg "white gold" porcelain archive get a 2012 touch from designer Hella Jongerius as she takes inspiration from the legacy catalogue to create white bowls adorned with hand-painted ceramic animals.See these and other Nymphenburg tableware in Gallery by the Harbour of Harbour City from 30 November to 17 December, with a festive 10% discount for pre-Christmas shoppers.
column38: 由錦藝舫﹙Galerie Huit﹚主辦的德國寧芬堡﹙Nymphenburg﹚皇室瓷器及首飾展將於2012年11月30日至12月17日在「海港城‧美術館」舉行，一次過展出總值過百萬的手製名瓷。屆時將展出著名設計師Patrick Muff所創作的瓷製首飾。首飾設計大方卻不失個性，主題圍繞天使翅膀、星星、骷髏等。另一位設計師Hella Jongerius於2012年為寧芬堡皇家瓷器設計了一系列動物瓷器，把擁有250年歷史的寧芬堡皇家瓷器重新演譯，創造出典雅可愛的動物瓷碟。寧芬堡皇家瓷器工坊座落於德國慕尼黑寧芬堡皇宮，由1747年當時的選帝侯爵馬克斯三世創建，是德國巴伐利亞皇家御用瓷器手工工坊，也是歐洲頂級老牌瓷器工坊之一。寧芬堡皇家瓷器的愛好者不乏來自世界各地皇室貴族世家、政商名流、影劇豪門與藝文界人士，包括英女皇、日皇夫婦、教宗、美國總統夫婦、溫莎公爵、泰國皇室等,就連新婚不久的英國威廉王子，都收到來賓送上的寧芬堡皇家瓷器作賀禮，可見這品牌在歐洲的地位超然。

column9: Picture This Gallery,Suite 1308, 13th Floor, 9 Queens Road Central, Hong Kong
column19: James Bond and the Big Screen Legends
column37:
Hong Kong’s one and only vintage poster gallery, Picture This, is pleased to present “James Bond and the Big Screen Legends”. This exhibition for sale is a celebration of poster art created to promote major cinema events dating from the 1950’s to today.

This year marks the 50th year since “Dr. No”, the first James Bond film, appeared on cinema screens around the globe. A highlight of “James Bond and the Big Screen Legends” is a collection of vintage and original memorabilia issued to promote the movies from the spy film series that has become one of the most influential and now the longest-running in cinema history. 

Extending from the early movies starring the first Bond actor, Sean Connery; “From Russia with Love”, “Goldfinger” and “You Only Live Twice”, to the later movies starring Roger Moore; “The Man with the Golden Gun”, “Moonraker” and “A View to a Kill”, Picture This celebrates the franchise’s history and the wonderful poster artwork created to promote these films.

column14: Hong Kong Convention And Exhibition Centre
column19: Uncatalogued: The Case of Oil Street Artist Village
column37:
In 2006, a member of Hong Kong’s artist community came into Asia Art Archive’s library before departing the city, and in haste, deposited a box of material related to Oil Street. Kept in AAA’s Special Collections room until 2011, the box was recently rediscovered to reveal a range of material around the Oil Street artist village and the ensuing 'Save Oil Street Campaign', which took place in the late 1990s.

Oil Street’s is a history built as much on gaps as on record and nostalgically lives on in the memory of the community as an important moment in the city’s cultural development—as an instance that allowed artists and organisations to engage in unconstrained experiments with large space at a low rent and as a precursor for the art community’s increasing engagement in attempts to safeguard cultural space in Hong Kong.

For AAA, the box represents an entry point through which to read and reinterpret a history as well as an opportunity to expose the complexities and ambiguities of the research process. With existing documentation, news clippings, letters, drawings, and photographs, and through conversations with members of the artist village, AAA reconstructs parallel timelines of the history of the site (1908 – present) and that of the artist village (1998 – 2000). AAA looks to playfully reflect on the subjectivity of memory through a series of new drawings of the site, and invites a wider interpretation of the material with talks by New York-based artist Paul Chan and local storyteller Uncle Hung Jai.

column37: In the exhibition, students from Academy of Visual Arts (HKBU), ELCHK Yuen Long Lutheran Secondary School, Precious Blood Secondary School, Lok Sin Tong Wong Chung King Secondary School, Yan Chai Hospital No.2 Secondary School, SKH All Saints Middle School reflected on the theme distance. Their works explored the distance to overcome the geographic, language and cultural differences between Hong Kong and Japan, in an effort to show support and care to the people suffered in the Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami in 2011.
column38: 本展覽將展出香港浸會大學視覺藝術院、元朗信義書院、寶血女子中學、樂善堂王仲銘中學、仁濟醫院第二中學及聖公會諸聖中學學生的創作。作品通過探討距離，克服香港及日本之間在地理、語言及文化上的差異，以關注2011年日本東北地震的災民。

column37: In this experimental exhibition, KACAMA presents three pieces of interesting work made by food scraps, bringing you a funny yet inspirational experience with leftovers.
column38: 一日三餐，為我們提供能量，應付日常生活所需。然而，在我們吃飽之後，剩飯菜渣卻只落得被送往堆填區的下場。一桌美味的價值，往往隨著一頓飯的終結而歸零。其實，這些飯菜渣滓，亦即所謂「廚餘」，潛藏著無限的可能性，只要細心發掘，也能為我們的生活增添養份。

column37: Each year AGI (Alliance Graphique Internationale) would host an exhibition as a platform for the exchange of thoughts and ideas. This year the exhibition will be held in Hong Kong in conjunction with the AGI Open with the theme “Heaven and Hell” – an extreme yet fitting term to describe this city full of contradictions. K11 will host an extension event of the AGI Open, featuring a selection of works from this year’s AGI participating artists.
column38: 國際平面設計聯盟‭‬‭ (AGI, Alliance Graphique Internationale) 的年度展覽，今年選定在香港舉行，和 AGI Open同期舉行，主題是「天堂與地獄」。‬‬天堂與地獄，是兩極，用來形容充滿矛盾的香港卻又十分恰當。而 K11 將為 AGI Open 舉辦伸活動，展出今年參與AGI的藝術家之精選作品。‬‬‬‬‬‬‬‬‬‬‬‬‬‬‬‬‬‬‬‬

column37:
“Metamorphosis” makes an accurate depiction of Wallace Chan’s mind and his process of creation. With precious time and efforts devoted into his jewellery art, he turns materials and craftsmanship into various forms of beauty, grasping the inspiration from within and converting his imagination, life experiences and way of thinking into the physical objects we see today. In his hands, natural elements such as metals, stones, water and fire are sent through metamorphosis to become pieces of jewellery art. He never ceases to challenge himself, even if it means completely destroying a nearly finished piece and starting all over again. Change is in his nature and perfection is always his aim. In Wallace Chan’s jewellery art, various elements are presented to inspire visually and conceptually. Every piece has a story to tell – they can be studied from all angles, and their viewers can find no fault. They can be worn on any fabrics, and their 
wearers can always find in them the true meaning of 
comfort.

column37:
Imagination without boundaries and limitations is the greatest treasure of mankind., while creativity is the combination of imagination and action. Creativity without boundaries has always been the fundamental creative concept of Graphic Airlines.
Departing from our innocent hearts, learning, growing and experiencing through the journey of creation. Creativity takes
us across boundaries like an airline, creativity itself is like a journey to rediscover our unique self. While boundaries and limitations being added throughout the journey of our growth, imaginations and spirit of adventure
are being neglected. From creativity to lifestyle; from country borders to our  esh, are all  lled with all kinds of
limitations and boundaries. We have become beings which are excellent at limiting others and ourselves, while life itself
should be much broader than we could possibly imagine, as if all di erent sorts of individuals are somehow being
connected, we are all simply part of the cycle of life. Even though we are only dust within the vast and ever expanding universe, but within us we all have our little universe with in nite power. There was never a beginning nor an end, life is journey without boundaries and limitations waiting for us to experience and discover.

column19: The Talking Art: Chinese Character as Image
column36: 陳伸 及 女兒 陳彥子、陳裕子、陳越子
column37: “We just need to look beyond the obvious and follow our heart to discover new possibilities.” As a merely aspiration, Sun Chan tried to make novel games and art works of Chinese characters, to keep his three Japan-born daughters interested in the Chinese language. Sun Chan embarked on the journey to explore with new forms of visual representations for Chinese characters (Hanzi). Driven by love and inner creative instinct, Chan reveals the distinct individualities and decorative appeals of Chinese characters, and also brings extra surprises to viewers with knowledge.
column38:
年逾80的秘魯華僑陳伸先生，自幼喜愛漢字。因戰亂關係，陳老先生在小學二年級時被迫輟學，但他一直沒有放棄學習，堅持邊工作邊自修學問。及後憑努力從貧困絕境到自營生計，再到成就事業。

數十年前，為了吸引三個在日本出生的女兒對中文的興趣，陳老先生花盡心思，於工餘時以新奇的方式，和悅目的色彩“畫”字（把字畫成圖畫）。並和女兒們一起觀賞，探索圖畫中的文字訊息。想不到這些親子時光，不但讓孩子愛上了漢字，更培養了父女間深厚的感情。

數十年後，三個女兒已有所成，大女兒彥子（獲獎建築師），次女裕子（律師）和小女兒越子（平面設計師）為向父親致意，特以其父當年的作品為藍本，再加以發揮，以繪畫、版畫、金屬製品及數碼媒體等形式完成一些衍生創作；並將於是次《圖話「看」字》展覽與父親的作品原稿一起展出。

陳氏父女兩代的漢字藝術創作，富有創意和現代感，其視覺魅力媲美萬花筒圖案。
家長帶同子女參觀，是理想的親子（及親字）活動外，更有助孩子擴闊視野和創意發展。

column37: Featuring a body of new artworks by the artist, Ecce Homo Trilogy I includes a large-scale text based installation, a series of video projections, and text paintings on aluminum plates. Centering on footage taken from the 1989 televised trial and subsequent public execution of Nicolae Ceausescu, the former Romanian leader of the communist regime, this in-situ project explores the subject of judgment and in particular, our moral complexity in response to formulating a judgment and the extent to which that compromises our dignity as a human being. Tsang Kin-Wah forces the visitor to engage in the work, involving them consciously as an observer, and encouraging them to consider how one human would go about making a judgment of another.

column37:
相比起二零一零年和去年重展的《Random Is Beautiful》，性質上可謂完全相反，因為在過去展出的大部分作品都是比較隨意和零碎，似是在亂中作一個較有序的安排。而今次的展覽《A Complete Shambles》，由構思、概念、用為作畫素材的模特兒到畫作本身及背後的意思都充滿著特定的框框，一些在創作上不應該出現的自定框架。而這次展覽的作品將會是一些實驗性以及帶有功能性的展品，除了藝術家應有的獨立自主觀點以外，在某程度上藝術本身也應當附有與觀眾一定的互動要素。雖然觀眾在會場瀏覽期間或許只會看到滿是密密麻麻的黑白色格子，但這正就是我在上一次重展時所提及的「悶納」，現在就是個作伸延、探討及反思的時候。
對於所提及的實驗性，在這裡亦不打算用文字一概而論，以免抹煞了僅餘的可能性，因每位觀眾看到事情都應有著不同的詮釋。再者，相比起作品表面只能帶出的觀感刺激，可觸發觀眾與非觀眾之間的溝通可能才是那真正要達到的目的。

column37: From the moment you wake up, how many printed commodities and advertisements do you encounter every day?  No doubt that we are overwhelmed by mass media images that appear on daily objects and urban environment, even blurring the line that separates painting from printed matter.  A graduate of Hong Kong Art School’s Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art) programme, Aaron Francis d'Aquino (2012 Graduate, majoring in Painting), would like to examine the borderline between printed matter and painting, and also to trigger viewers to rethink the purpose of painting through this exhibition.
column38: 試由你起床那刻開始計算，每天會見到多少傳銷產品及平面廣告？無可否認，大眾媒體的圖像透過不同形式，在日常生活用品及市區環境中呈現及充斥於我們的生活，甚至令繪畫與印刷品之間的界線變得模糊。杜卓璣，香港藝術學院藝術文學士課程之畢業生（2012年畢業，主修繪畫），透過是次展覽不但探討了印刷品與繪畫之間的分界線，還引起觀眾反思繪畫真正的目的。

column37: Rhyme Lotus – Wang Shouqing contemporary Chinese ink exhibition. He is one of the most famous contemporary artists in Hong Kong. Seasons of lotus surrounding Hong Kong suburban area is the main theme of this exhibition series. Through his magnificent and innovative painting techniques on paper and silk, the lotus has become lively and vivid. Audience can effortlessly enter the quiet and ethereal mood of the intended meaning of his art works.
