column37: The artists express their feelings through their works which convey their impressions of Hong Kong, revealing the glamour of the Pearl of the Oriental. Some paintings display the highly developed sides of Hong Kong such as the mysterious Victoria Harbour under the setting sun, the evening lights shining on the seaport, the international financial center in the mist, and the skyscrapers as Bank of China Tower. More of the paintings focus on the beautiful views of New Territories which is almost forgotten by urbanites, such as the Natural scenery in Nam Sang Wai, lovely wild birds, jiggly boats at the habour of refuge etc. Those works remind us that Hong Kong is not only a prosperous international city but also a place which has pleasant and comely original ecological landscape. Artists appeal to us that we should not forget that as city without darkness, Hong Kong is also a natural home for everybody. We should protect the environment here, and help Hong Kong to live up to the name of the world's most livable city.
column38: 他們用自己的繪畫抒發情感，作品展現了他們心中的香港印象和對香港的美好情思，展現了東方之珠的魅力。如：夕陽下神秘的維多利亞港灣，有港灣兩岸華燈初上，有璀璨絢麗的霓虹閃耀，有迷霧中的“國際金融中心”，還有“中銀大廈”等等高矗入雲的建築群群。作品充分表現了高度發達、商業繁榮的香港景象。更多的作品則展現了被許多都市人遺忘的新界風光，如：南生圍的純樸自然風貌和植物、鳥類的野趣，還有避風港晃晃悠悠的小漁船……這些作品提醒人們，哦！原來香港不僅僅是個繁華的國際大都市，而且還有這麼一片風景宜人、景色秀麗的原生態景觀。藝術家呼籲大家不要忘了這東方不夜城------香港的另一個角落。這是一塊讓人反璞歸真的大自然家園。喚起人們要保護、愛惜香港大自然的環境。保育好香港這塊美麗的土地。讓香港真正無愧於“全球最宜居城市”之美稱！

column37: HAJI Gallery and Ippou Creative House proudly present “Eye-Catching Sketch Exhibition” featuring the world-renowned illustrator and artist Lee Chi-ching. Lee is a world-renowned illustrator and artist focus on comics and contemporary art in Hong Kong. He is the creator of Romance of the Three Kingdoms, the first set of Hong Kong comics published in Japan. His historical comic Sun Zi's Tactics won the Gold Award (The Best Work) at the 1st International MANGA Award organized by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Japan in 2007, and he was the first Hong Kong comic artist to win such an important international award.
column38:
香港藝術家李志清，是國際知名的華人畫家，
是第一位在日本發表漫畫作品的香港漫畫家，
亦是日本首屆「國際漫畫賞」最高榮譽之「最優秀作品獎」的得主。
他的作品具有鮮明的個人風格特色，
尤其是其「水墨」元素，使他筆下的人物、景物更具神韻。

是次展出的65幅畫作，
是李志清除卻漫畫、插畫、水墨畫、西洋畫以外鮮為人知的速寫作品，
亦是李志清過去二十多年遊歷速寫的一少部份，
包括遊歷香港、澳門、中國、日本、匈牙利等地時繪畫的速寫。
其中一幅《太平山街》更是為這次展覽而特意繪畫。

細緻具體的風景描繪，
色彩運用淋漓盡致的水彩速寫，線條簡單直接的抽象素描，
充分表現李志清的速寫技法之變化多端，
處處流露著他的人生點滴及生活思考，
及使我們對身邊的事物有更深刻的體會，更能欣賞生活上種種的美。

“速寫，是一種獨立的藝術表現，
用筆與紙，細細地品味著身邊的事物，
成為記憶的橋樑、創作的根本。
好的速寫，在寥寥數筆便能顯現出一種意境、一種韻味，
充滿畫家的個人情感與思想智慧。
一幅速寫絕不比一幅苦心經營的油畫遜色。”

column37:
To smell the paint of “RED”! “Red” is an award winning Broadway play about the legendary Russian-American artist Mark Rothko. The play is adapted in Cantonese by Hong Kong Repertory Theatre, the longest standing and largest professional theatre company in Hong Kong. We are all waiting for a splash of RED! Inspired by the play “RED” and Mark Rothko, HAJI Gallery and the Hong Kong Repertory Theatre team make and mix paint. Together we create art!
The exhibits combine the onstage art at “RED” and a live painting session held at HAJI Gallery. RED premiered at Hong Kong City Hall Theatre on July 6. The “RED” exhibited at Hong Kong City Hall on July 6 – July 15, 2012 and HAJI Gallery on July 18 – July 31, 2012

column37: “This is Totemo Japanese Illustration Exhibition by Peggy Sen Sei”, is an illustration exhibition by a rising artist, Peggy, showing her passion of art with a cultural touch. Peggy Sen Sei is a multi-media artist, she is a journalist at mainstream media, a writer and also a Japanese teacher, an interpreter and a translator. Her works include “Crayon Shin-chan” and The series of “Neon Genesis Evangelion”. Her new book just released at the Hong Kong Book Fair 2012. Peggy, a local Hong Kong born Chinese artist, loves the cultural clash and magic between Chinese and Japanese language. Through her illustration, daily life is painted on the cultural differences between Japanese and Chinese.

日文跟我們看似很相近，
卻又很遠－－平假名中帶幾粒漢字，
好讓我們估估下，又未必猜得出真相。
今次畫展會以圖像解拆這曖昧的文字，
讓我們體會這語言的真義。

column37:
“This body of work is mainly created by dotted paint with various levels of transparency and simple color tone. My technique is a repetition of circular brush motions. Although this is a repetition of motion, each result is never a perfect replica of the previous one. This is an unconscious act that reflects our natural providence.

Rain never comes from the ground to the sky for there is a gravity. As a human being living under such natural providence, I ought not to go against it, but to investigating by my own sense, emotions and consciousness.

An unconscious equation that stays in my mind: HUMAN BEING = Cycle of Nature = Revolution + Repetition = STATE OF LIVING

I shall continue to form new equations living under this natural providence, through my art and my life.”

“I am trying to express the Nature but this Natural become more and more unnatural. I am trying and challenging to express how to achieve True Nature and my scene for nature with Noble Spirit to Nature. I appreciate audience to enjoy the nature and the Nature scene through me. I want audience feel the relationship between nature and people.” By AYUMI ADACHI

column37: Based in America, the France-born artist Jules De Balincourt uses his own distinctive visual language in creating new meanings for the painting medium. In the face of the current unstable global situation that demands immediate responses, and the ever-changing trends of new mediums, it seems that the many forms of expression related to painting such as Expressionism, Impressionism, Figuration, and Abstraction are utterly lost in portraying the world today. As a new generation contemporary artist, Balincourt utilizes abstract visual language and direct societal subject matter in creating diversified visuals of content and space in his works. At the same time, embedded with a contemporary view, the themes presented are able to evoke an intricate connection with the viewers, allowing them to immerse freely within. For example, often times different imaginations and interpretations would go on in the artist’s mind while he is in the process of creating a work. When illustrating a sport stadium, scenes of sport competitions, images of a hastily set-up refugee asylum or an arena to be under terrorist attack would appear as compositions in his thoughts. Through the combination of the real and abstract, Balincourt’s works expand the viewer’s imaginary realm into unlimited possibilities; breaking through the siege made on painting expression by the on-screen alterations in new mediums.

column9: Gallery Livi, No.5 Ladder Street, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong
column37: In her paintings, drawings and mixed-media works, CHAN Lai-kuen fabricates a sensuous, mesmerising or at times unsettling world that is both homely and strange. The home is one’s first cosmos, and is the haven of daydream and spring of memory, according to Gaston Bachelard in his La poetique de l’espace. Likewise, Chan’s sources of inspiration - once ubiquitous patterns on household objects, folk art, domestic animals, and monsters – come from the home and memory of it, which have fascinated the artist since early childhood.

column9: Gallery Livi, No.5 Ladder Street, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong
column37: Lam’s works take references from the styles of traditional Chinese painting shanshui (“mountain-water landscapes”) and Japanese ukiyo-e (“pictures of the floating world”), also outline drawing, the most primitive form of art expression. Motifs of the sceneries, like mountains, trees, flowers, rocks, rivers, sea waves and waterfalls are actually images found on the internet; and instead of paper and ink, these scenes on computer screen are elaborated in oil on canvas with clean and delicate lines. His digital landscapes play with the contrasts between the orient and the western, nature and technology, archaic and contemporary.

column37: A vibrant and dynamic exhibition by eight international artists based in Hong Kong. Reflecting upon their own personal journeys within art and throughout Asia and the world, Artists Abroad are proud to present their annual exhibition ’Journey’.Over the last eighteen years Artists Abroad has secured a firm position in Hong Kong’s vibrant art scene, with its members drawing inspiration from Asia’s rich visual tapestry and their own cultural backgrounds. Working in a variety of media including oils, printmaking, watercolour and mixed media the group reflect the rich diversity of the contemporary art world

The exhibition features a collection of watercolour paintings by April Chan. Through the medium of watercolour, she expresses the passion inspired in her by the concerto - in particular its radical impact on the form and language of music. The artist’s treatment of her subjects reflects the dynamic flux of musical creation.

column37: The A·lift Gallery 'CHECKPOINT' will be opening on 14th September 2012 at G/F, 24C, Tai Ping Shan Street, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong. 'CHECKPOINT' will become the outpost which connects Hong Kong and Shenzhen. Our main aim is to link up commercial dealings and educational discussions through the gallery. For the opening, we are specially holding 'Preview…' as our first exhibition. We will be showing the latest works of local emerging artists YIU Chu-tung, WONG Xiang-yi and NGAI Joe-Joe. The opening exhibition is named 'Preview…' with intent to show the desired scene that we wish to create jointly with Hong Kong artists in the future.

「提藝廊 • 站臺」將於二零一二年九月十四日假香港上環太平山街 24C 舖隆重開張。
「提藝廊 • 站臺」將作為我們連接香港及深圳的藝術前哨站，在此接連商業買賣與學術討論。我們特意舉辦《預覽…》藝術作品聯展，作為我們首個亮相之開幕展覽；屆時我們將展示本地藝壇新進姚柱東、黃向藝，以及魏凱畧之藝術新作。開幕展覽名題《預覽…》，有意藉此展示我們與香港藝術家，共同攜手創建本地藝術未來環境及市場發展的願景。

column37: Vivian Ho’s paintings of slaughtered animals are like still-life. She draws the butcher of livestock with vivid hues and light ink wash. The killed individuals are piled up and become residues with no soul. Vivian chooses not to paint the brutality of human to control others’ lives with bloody images. She suppresses the dark side and makes disturbed scenes poetic. The pleasant images satirize the beautiful lies that human often make to cover inhumane behaviour and the self-deception attitude.
column38: 透過一幅幅猶如靜物寫生、以被屠宰的動物為主題的畫作，何博欣以絢麗的顏色及淡淡的水墨繪畫牲畜遭人類宰殺、切割、處理，然後成為食材。生命的個體被屠宰後被堆疊起來，剩下一堆沒靈魂的渣滓。何博欣不用血淋淋的影像去表達人類殘酷的控制別的生命，她抑壓了黑暗面，把令人不安的東西畫得富美感，悅目的畫面像在諷刺人類常以美麗的謊言和自我欺騙的態度去包裝著不仁道的行為。

column9: White Cube Hong Kong 50 Connaught Road Central
column37:
Kiefer presented a  body of work that continued the major themes of history, landscape and myth in his work, including large-scale landscape paintings and lead and steel sculptures. The exhibition's title, 'Let a Thousand Flowers Bloom', is knowingly ironic. It refers both to the epic, blooming landscapes of these pictures but also to a common misquotation in the West of a well-known phrase pronounced by Chairman Mao in 1957 which, while ostensibly encouraging cultural plurality, led to the deaths of millions and the final curtailment of any and all forms of dissent.

The paintings in this exhibition relate to a series that Kiefer began in 2000, using landscapes from the photographs that he had taken on his travels through China in 1993. These works, however, are more generic since the landscapes are based on a trip the artist made to the Auvergne region of France during springtime, a mountainous area in full bloom. These monumental paintings depict bountiful fields of flowers thickly painted in neutral colours, suggesting natural profundity and fertility but also entropy, as the display seems just past its point of perfection. Sunflowers, poppies and other flowers sit atop a mass of tangled stems, stalks and foliage which have been partly ruined – a dissolving mass of plant matter that holds the possibility of its imminent collapse.

In some paintings the figure of Mao can be seen either painted within the landscape, emerging from the flowers his hand in a beckoning salute or, in some cases – for example in 'Laßt tausend Blumen blühen' (2012) – painted on a section of canvas placed either above the central panel or on one side. Kiefer has described this gesture as a kind of 'dadaist absurdity' since the figure of Mao is an impossible one, modelled not on documentary photographs of the dictator but rather on the prefabricated sculptures of him that were found all over China. As with all of Kiefer's works, the ambitious scale in these paintings envelops their viewers by submerging them visually into the picture. In 'Gebrochen Bluemen und Gras' (2012), a mass of flowers and grass covers the canvas from the perspective of someone lying within the flowers and, in another, 'Le dormeur du val' (2012), the canvas is bisected by a path that leads from middle foreground to middle horizon, making the viewer feel as if they could actually enter the image.

Kiefer also presented two new sculptures in the exhibition. Made from plaster, steel and lead, they depict a classic symbol of Communist China: the bicycle, crushed under the weight of huge lead books, an enduring and reappearing motif throughout the artist's work.

Kiefer's paintings and sculpture have always reflected a profound scepticism of political regimes and overarching ideologies. For him, landscape can never reflect pure beauty, since it is always inscribed with historical events and, therefore, the struggles of ideology and power. Mao is an ambiguous icon but one that resonates with themes from Kiefer's earlier works, in particular his paintings of the spaces of Nazi Germany. These trans-historical references lend his paintings their multi-layered complexity, something that author and curator Kevin Power has described as a search for ‘systems of correspondences, a constant pattern of echoes’.
column38:
White Cube Hong Kong隆重宣布國際知名藝術家安森．基弗（Anselm Kiefer）在中國舉行的首個個人展覽，展出其最新的油畫及雕塑作品。

基弗將繼續圍繞歷史、景觀和神話這些主題，展示全新的大型風景畫作，以及由鉛和鋼所鑄造的雕塑作品。展覽的標題《讓繁花盛放》語帶相關，它既指畫作史詩式的盛放景觀，亦諷刺西方經常錯誤引述毛主席在1957年提出的口號—表面上鼓勵文化多元性，卻導致數以百萬計的人死亡，並在最終抹煞任何形式的異議。

基弗是次的畫作以當年於1993年在中國旅行時所拍攝的照片為基礎，並於2000年開始創作的一系列全新畫作。然而，新作在相比之下，卻屬於總攬性的，這是因為畫中的風景來自藝術家在春天期間的一趟法國奧弗涅地區之旅：繁花錦簇，盛放山頭。這些不朽的畫作以厚重質感的自然色系來繪畫，描繪出百花之繁盛，表現出自然的奧妙和繁殖力，以及自然的失衡：就像完美逝去的展示。向日葵、罌粟花及其他花朵豎立在糾結的根莖和葉子之上—它們有部位已被毀壞，植物物質大量溶解，面臨即將瓦解的可能性。

在某些畫作，毛澤東的肖像可能在風景內出現，在花團中招手致敬，又或者，如像《讓繁花盛放》（Laßt tausend Blumen blühen，2012年）般出現在畫布的其中一個部份，然後被放置在中央板面的上方或旁邊。基弗把這種姿態形容為「達達式的荒謬」，因為毛澤東的肖像是不可能的肖像：它不是出自這位獨裁者的紀實照片，而是出自他遍佈中國的預製雕塑藍本。猶如基弗所有的作品，這些規模宏偉的畫作籠罩着他們的觀眾，讓他們的視覺淹沒在圖片之內。在《殘花敗草》（Gebrochen Bluemen und Gras，2012），大量的花草覆蓋畫布，猶如以置身花海的人之角度出發；另一幅《山谷臥者》（ Le dormeur du val，2012 ），則以一條小徑把畫布自中間前景至中間地平線一分為二，讓觀者認為他們可以確實進入圖像之內。

基弗亦將展出兩個全新的雕塑，雕塑以石膏、鋼鐵和鉛所製成，描繪出共產中國的典型象徵：自行車—被巨大的鉛製書籍重重壓碎，而這些書籍則是藝術家恆常重現的貫徹主題。

基弗的油畫和雕塑，一直反映出他對政治制度和整體意識形態的深切懷疑。對他來說，景觀永遠無法反映出純粹的美，因為它總是刻劃着歷史事件，因此出現意識形態和權力的鬥爭。毛澤東這個模糊的偶像，與基弗的早期作品之主題產生共鳴，特別是他關於德國納粹空間的作品。跨歷史的素材，讓基弗的畫作擁有複雜的層次，作家和策展人凱文．包華（Kevin Power）形容這是一種追尋「持續共鳴模式的對應系統」的創作。

column9: Galerie Huit,G/F, No. 8, St. Francis Street, Wanchai, Hong Kong
column10: 香港灣仔聖佛蘭士街8號地下錦藝舫
column37: Julius Baer and Galerie Huit are proud to present 20 Wang Yehan’s works within the “Metropolis-Pixel” series to Hong Kong between 4th – 10th October 2012. 7 out of the 20 artworks have never been exhibited outside of mainland China before. Exhibition will be held from 4 Oct to 10 Oct at The Rotunda,Exchange Square,Central, Hong Kong. The striking abstract work of Wang Yehan is characterised by unmistakable bold swirling pebble dashes. The pieces horizons’ are only limited by the viewer’s imagination. Each piece features dynamic shapes and forms which morph in and out of focus like an optical illusion or a trick of the light. “Metropolis-Pixel” series is a metamorphosis in artwork, reborn from Wang’s abstract language and style innovation following his exhibits within the Natural Abstract series and City Surface series. It was from his 2011 solo exhibition in the Today Art Museum in Beijing, that art observers started to refer to Wang Yehan’s distinctive style as “Metropolis-Pixel”. Popular with both corporate and private art lovers, Wang Yehan’s works feature internationally in collections such as those of the Grand Hyatt hotels, the HSBC Bank, the Shanghai Cultural Development Foundation, Zhejiang Museum in Hangzhou and the luxury Art Hotel in the USA.
column38: 瑞士寶盛（Julius Baer）與錦藝舫（Galerie Huit）攜手呈獻中國當代藝術家王益輝最新個人作品展覽。這次展覽將展出王益輝《都市‧像素》系列中的二十幅作品，其中七幅是首次在中國大陸以外地區展出。 展期由2012年10月4日至10日,地點為香港中環交易廣場中央大廳。 王益輝的抽象作品引人注目的特點在於其縱橫交錯的短促筆觸。他的每件作品都展現出流動的形狀和美態，在焦點轉移之瞬間，營造出視覺或光線上的錯覺，讓觀賞者可以釋放無窮的想像力。 《都市‧像素》系列代表著王益輝作品風格上的蛻變，從其《自然抽象》系列和《都市表層》系列，蛻變出嶄新的抽象藝術語言和創作風格。自2011年北京今日美術館為他舉辦個人展覽後，藝術鑑賞者開始將其獨特的風格稱為《都市‧像素》。 王益輝的作品廣受企業和私人藝術愛好者歡迎，更被君悅酒店、匯豐銀行、上海文化發展基金會、浙江美術館和美國Luxury Art Hotel等眾多國際知名機構納入收藏。

column9: Mischmasch Gallery: Unit A 18/F Shing Hing Commercial Building, 21-27 Wing Kut Street, Central, Hong Kong
column10: 香港中環永吉街21－27號誠興商業大廈18樓A室
column35: Emily Lau, Michele Guidarini, Jenny Meyer
column37: Today, we are impossibly busy and frazzled, from chasing our dreams, to dodging distractions from frivolous pop culture, to keeping up with our own digital personas — all the while trying to salvage fleeting moments of peace. Swimming in an overwhelming ocean of information and peculiarities, we grow sensitive to ironies, we learn to manipulate and distort contexts. Through three artists from three different cities, “We Heart Chaos!” is an investigation into the ways in which we negotiate the proliferation of mass media, and steer through the endless bombardment of images, theories, adverts, and ideas to turn them into vibrant dialogues of new meaning, fun and beauty

column9: 28 Tai Ping Shan Street, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong
column37: ‘Portraiting on the Steppe’ is an exhibition engages with the Buddhism and the folk stories of the Buryat people – who mainly live on a large steppe where dramatic climate varies from 40°C to -40°C. This is also an in-between area lies on the border of Mongolia and Russia, where the political, social and cultural affairs are always peripheral and ambiguous. Through figurative images, Zorikto portrays this adventurous, unique and understated side of another Asia.

column9: 28 Tai Ping Shan Street, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong
column37: The title of the exhibition, ‘Touched: Faces & Masks’, refers to the state when the viewer interacts with the world depicted by Sonya in which familiar faces and objects often appear alongside fragmentary images. The total effect is not simply one of harmony or beauty, but the viewer is confronted with scenes in which various images are intertwined into a peaceful chaos. Being ‘touched’, reality and fantasy suddenly intermingle as in daydreams. It is not a world of secular abundance, but a dynamic realm with a psychological splash and depth.

column37: Since its inception in April 2011, Golden Painting Group has attracted a great deal of attention and aroused the interest in art among many people. From pencil sketching to acrylic painting, from paper to canvas, from a green hand to adept rendering, the participants have fascinated both the instructors and staff at the Centre by their perseverance and ability to concentrate. In celebration of 10th anniversary of TWGHs Jockey Club Tai Kok Tsui Integrated Services Centre, Golden Painting Group is holding a formal art exhibition, so that the community can share the joy and amazing outcome of the participants’ efforts.
column38: 「耆樂畫室」由二零一一年四月成立至今，學員的作品已經吸引很多人的駐足欣賞，同時亦引起大家對藝術創作的興趣; 由素描至塑膠彩運用，由紙張畫到油畫布上，由零經驗到落筆奔放自如，都讓導師及中心工作人員驚歎她們的毅力及學習專注力。藉著東華三院賽馬會大角咀綜合服務中心的十週年紀念的大日子，「耆樂畫室」特意為學員舉辦一個正式的畫展，讓學員把一年以來學習西洋繪畫的喜悅及學習成果，與社區人士分享。

column19: Another Sphere2- Painting Exhibition by people with autism
column20: 界2-自閉症人士繪畫作品展
column37: Most autistic individuals may lack the verbal capacity to convey their feelings. However, through painting and drawing, they can fully express their inner world, their love and likings, their perseverance, and their amazing visual memory. Entitled Another Sphere, this exhibition invites viewers to go beyond their own boundary and enter the sphere of autistic individuals. It is intended to be their mind broadening and enriching experience that brings joy to them. This exhibition shows mainly two-dimensional works, featuring the artist s’ individual stories.
column38: 自閉症人士，他們大多不善於用言語來表達他們的感受，但是，卻可以用繪畫來描畫出獨特的內心世界。他們的喜與愛，他們的堅持，他們非一般的視覺記憶。展覽定名為”界”，希望我們在看過展覽後，與自閉症人士之間的界限可以被跨越，也希望我們看過之後心界可以敞開，變得更快樂! 展覽以平面作品為主，每人藉此講述自己的故事。

column19: “IMpression and IMage, Artworks of LIU Tung-mui & LIU Cheng-mui”

column37: The last joint exhibition, “Trajectories” of LIU Tung-mui and LIU Cheng-mui was in 2001. 11 years later, they joint hands again to have the exhibition. Tung-mui will show a series of acrylic paintings which never been exhibited, and Cheng-mui will show her fruitful outcome after years of printmaking.
column38: 2001年，廖東梅、廖井梅合辦了「軌跡」。十一年後，她倆再次聯展，這次東梅會展出一批從未展出過的塑膠彩畫本，而井梅會展出多年板畫創作的成果。

column19: Yin Jun & Yin Kun Joint Exhibiton
column37:
The artists, although brothers, have a very diverse style of painting and their artwork display distinct differences. “Everyone experiences life differently, so our interpretations are bound to be different”, Yin Jun explained of their distinct styles.

The elder brother Yin Kun, is famous for his Chinese Fairytales – Heroes series. His paintings feature drooling babies in military uniforms, often holding spears, guns or other interesting subjects. Yin Jun, on the other hand, also features babies in his paintings but they are all in tears. He paints them with round heads, big mouths, and big teardrops that are very expressive and exaggerated.

column19: " Floating in Art" - an Ebru painting exhibition
column37:
This is Danilo Giannoni’s premiere exhibition in Hong Kong. Danilo will showcase the evolution of his journey in Ebru,the ancient Turkish technique of painting on the water. From the traditional 
marbling technique and drawing of symbolic flowers, he has updated the technique by using innovative methods and materials to create a new figurative style that hints of silhouettes and figures.  www.facebook.com/sensoitalianoltd

column19: The Art Space of Wu Guanzhong
column37: Baiyaxuan - “The Art Space of Wu Guanzhong” is opened at Baiyaxuan Gallery shop no.3. Mr. Wu spent all his life to promote the development of arts and culture, also hoped his artwork can be spread to the public widely. Baiyaxuan deeply agrees with this idea, hence to cooperate with Mr. Wu on more than hundreds of pieces of limited edition prints reproductions and derivative art product since many years ago. “The Art Space of Wu Guanzhong” mainly displays more than 20 pieces of prints of Wu’s ink painting and oil painting, including the autographed limited edition prints which the process of printmaking are supervised by Wu Guanzhon himself, it is very valuable for collection. The space also displays some painting album and books which are published by Baiyaxuan and some other publish institutions, let the audience get to know about Wu Guanzhong not limited from his art works, but also from his words, to have a deeper understanding of this Chinese artist who occupies an important position in the modern art history, and gained high respect from the people.

column19: Abstract Art Group Exhibition I - Phrase of Heart
column37: VA Gallery will present “Phase of Heart--‐Abstract Art Group Exhibition I” on 4 Aug2012. In the recent years, Chinese abstract art has been acclaimed maximum attention by domestic and international art world. VA Gallery selects meticulously the important artists from region of mainland China and Hong Kong to showcase the viewing platform of the Chinese abstract art to us. Due to abstract art is obscured behind from reality, we impose “Phase of Heart” as the title. It results from real life at a height of detachment and the inner move is fully mobilized by the core activities of creative form. This advance form just accurately reflect the heart with unaware of truth. Old China since the ancient times, in observation of people all the spirit inside, all the form outside; heart identifiable through phase. In adopting the ancient concept to read people, we merely observe the face of people turning into observe the face of painting, and hence observe the back of ourselves. The exhibition will be the emphasized event by VA Gallery and also become the constantly annual activities. The exhibition will end on 29 Aug 2012.

LDX Gallery @ ART ONE
香港灣仔港灣道1號會展廣場辦公大樓閣樓Gallery 13
column37: Despite a predominantly male art scene, the presence of female artists in China has burgeoned ever since the 1970s. They challenge traditional and misogynistic stereotypes of women, continually pursuing new grounds of self-actualization. This exhibition presents two female artists, Chen Qingqing and Xiong Wenyun, whose works refashion traditional symbols of femininity into contemporary icons of modernity.

column37: Globalization is gradually eclipsing individuality, defining humanity in this modern era. This exhibition presents two artists, XU HUI and XU RUOTAO, whose works manifest the common ground of raw humanity, emotions. Internalizing multimedia into their stylistic repertoire, the two artists impart their intimate renditions of the essence of humanity, outreaching boundaries of thoughts, gender and nationality.

column37:
Picasso is one of the most influential figures in the 20th century art history. His art works include oil paintings, drawings, sculptures, collages, and ceramics etc. His success is based on all the art techniques and theory trainings that he acquired in his young age. Picasso and Georges Braque developed cubism painting style which revolutionized the field of art and moved him up in the world. As a result, he has become an extremely prominent and valuable artist in the century.
It is by far the most comprehensive exhibition of Picasso’s works ever held in Hong Kong, which will take place at Hong Kong Heritage Museum from 19 May to 12 July. In total, 50 original paintings will be displayed, including well-known pieces such as “La fillette aux pieds nus (The barefoot girl),” “Le sculpteur (The Sculptor),” and “Portrait de Dora Maar (Portrait of Dora Maar)” as well as his other works that closely related to his personal life, “Femme assise dans un fauteuil rouge (Woman sitting on a red chair)”.

column19: Art of Nature HK - Conetmporary Art Exhibition
column35: Lin Minggang, Wang Shouquing, Xu Enqi, Chung Kinsan
column37: Art of Nature will launch an art exhibition at ART ONE Gallery, Wanchai in May. It will exhibit some classic artworks of four contemporary local artists from Art of Nature, including Mr. Lin Minggang, Mr. Wang Shouqing, Mr. Xu Enqi and Mr. Chung Kinsan. Those artists have been rooted in the eastern culture and integrating the west into east. They created their artworks based on the idea of manifestation of nature and infinity of vitality in the eastern culture. They are willing to explore and create their own art language. They participated in a number of solo and joint exhibitions around the world. Their art pieces have been collected by some well known art organizations and art lovers. The upcoming exhibition is a great opportunity to promote contemporary art in Hong Kong and it will be a valuable visual banquet for all art lovers

column37: The Six Realms, or sometimes known as Wheel of Life, are an allegorical description of conditioned existence, or samsara, into which beings are reincarnated and reborn. The nature of one's existence is determined by karma. Some realms seem more pleasant than others, but all are dukkha, meaning they are temporary and imperfect. In Buddism, one who needs to take the tonsure before he becomes a monk. Hair represents all the bitterness in the world. Head shaving indicates that one erases all the bitterness and affliction borne by the world.It also signifies that one is prepared to cultivate himself according to a religious doctrine with undivided attention

This transnational joint exhibition will create a series of photography artwork that are based on renown Chinese artist Feng Zhangjie’s paintings. Several internationally acclaimed photographers will produce a series 8 images with 8 international asian models. 4 images will be shot in Beijing by beauty photographer Justin Cooper while fashion photographer Zach Gold will execute the other 4 images in NYC. The project will be styled by NYC fashion stylist Julie Ragolia with a special one off wardrobe create by Chinese fashion designer Christine Lau. In Beijing hair and makeup will come from Wang Qian and Chen Tao while the project will be art directed by Fran Lam.

column20: The Repository of Coherent Babbles - Painting On and On (1)
column29: a group of Hong Kong painters in the Spring of 2011
column30: 一群香港畫家於2011 年春天發起
column35: Sushan CHAN, HO Sin Tung, Cassian LAU, Joey LEUNG, Vivian POON, Wilson SHIEH and TSE Yim On
column36: 陳素珊、何倩彤、劉啓舜、梁嘉賢、潘蔚然、石家豪及謝炎安
column37:
Painting On and On presents a series of exhibitions proposing various discourses on painting in Hong Kong today. The first instalment of this project will feature works by more than thirty local painters, ranging from early practitioners of the 1970s to a selection of emerging artists. Born out of a desire to stimulate interest, the thematic exhibitions, seminars, workshops and a publication are documentations of the artists’ collaboration, commonalities and mutual influences.
The first exhibition in the programme, “The Repository of Coherent Babbles” includes works by Sushan CHAN, HO Sin Tung, Cassian LAU, Joey LEUNG, Vivian POON, Wilson SHIEH and TSE Yim On. The use of figuration and narrative has had a long tradition in
painting. With the movement gaining momentum since the late 1990s in Hong Kong, artists employ the quotidian to question the descriptive and representational limitations of the medium. The painters in this exhibition combine inspirations from Chinese and
Western figuration, mythology, fables, surrealism, comics, animation, film and literature into visual narrations of contemporary realities.
column38:
《繪畫大道中》將舉辦展覽系列，探討五個香港當代繪畫的主題。這個計劃之首輪活動召集了三十多位創作形態各異的藝術家，當中包含七十年代的前輩畫家以至近期正在崛起的年輕畫家。藉着這群藝術家共同籌劃的主題展覽、專題講座、工作坊及出版物，為他們的合作過程、共通點和大家的相互影響作一個記錄，希望提供更多理解當代香港繪畫的切入點。
首個展覽《妄想專門店》包括陳素珊、何倩彤、劉啓舜、梁嘉賢、潘蔚然、石家豪及謝炎安的作品。以人物及敘事為主軸的繪畫，歷史悠久。香港在九十年代末開始出現一批畫家，利用日常生活點滴作題材來挑戰繪畫這個媒介中描述和表徵的局限。今次展覽的畫家把中外畫風、傳奇、童話、動漫、超現實主義，加上電影及文學等原材，揉合成現今生活的視覺敘事。
《繪畫大道中》計劃由一群香港畫家於2011 年春天發起，以藝術家主導為推行此計劃之原則。今次展覽系列由安全口畫廊SOUTHSITE 協辦。

column37:
Following Paris-based Chinese female artist Jia Juan Li’s retrospective show of the same title at Today’s Art Museum in Beijing last year, this solo exhibition “Searching for Missing Dreams” celebrates the important milestone in Jia’s career as well as her achievements as one of the greatest Chinese female artist.

The exhibition will feature mostly Jia's well-loved garden series and Qing princess portraits, ranging from smaller single portraits to larger four-panel works.

column34: A. D. Coleman（攝影評論家、歷史學家）、Guy Sorman（哲學家）
column37: The Silent Strength of Liu Xia comprises twenty-six photographs made by Beijing photographer and poet Liu Xia (wife of 2010 Nobel Peace Prize Laureate Liu Xiaobo).  This show premiered in Boulogne, France in October 2011.  Most recently it was on view at the Italian Academy at Columbia University, New York.  The current exhibition will be held at the City University of Hong Kong and the Hong Kong Arts Centre — the first showing of these pictures on Chinese soil.
column38: 《沉默的力量》攝影展包涵北京攝影家、詩人劉霞的二十六張黑白攝影作品。她的丈夫是二零一零年諾貝爾和平獎得主劉曉波。這些作品於二零一一年十月於法國布洛涅（Boulogne）首次面世，繼之在美國哥倫比亞大學意大利學院展出。作品如今移師香港，分別展於城市大學及香港藝術中心。這些震撼人心的作品首次在中國土地上展覽。

column37: The exhibition presents part of the work from Harlim Djauhar Winata’s first book for fashion photography lovers — 180 – 8 x 10 Polaroid Works.  The event will showcase portraits enlarged and produced by large-format 8 x 10 Polaroid film which had ceased production since 2009.  The timeless black and white fashion images captured in this project delivers an aesthetic quality that cannot be replicated by digital cameras.

column37: CONTEMPORARY BY ANGELA LI is proud to present a mini-retrospective exhibition of celebrated Chinese artist Chen Jiagang at our booth at this year’s ART HK 12. On show will be a selection of Chen Jiagang’s most iconic large format photographs, including an amazing 4-metre edition on 3 panels, from his Third Front, Smog City, Temptation, Diseased City and the most recent Great Three Gorges series

column9: Contemporary By Angela Li Gallery, G/F, 248 Hollywood Road, Sheung Wan
column19: Metamorphosis- New Cocoon Works by Peter Steinhauer
column37:
Since 1993, Peter has been documenting the many facets of Asian culture. This, his Cocoon series, is somewhat an artistic departure from his previous works as this project is predominately photographed and printed in colour.

Upon Peter’s first visit to Hong Kong in January of 1994, he arrived at the old Kai Tak International Airport, on exiting via taxi he noticed a very large structure that was surrounded in yellow packaging on the bottom and the top half was encapsulated in bamboo. He was amazed by the monumental size of this structure and not surprisingly made easy comparisons to the environmental Bulgarian artist Christo and his wife Jean Claude and wondered if perhaps they were exhibiting in Hong Kong and wrapping a building. He saw many more on the way to Hong Kong Island and then quickly realised that this was a form of renovation on old and new buildings. These large wrapped buildings were particularly striking with the backdrop of the dense urban confides of Kowloon and Hong Kong Island.

Herein began Peter’s fascination with these multicoloured structures, standing out like giant wrapped packages in the midst of the neutral, almost monochromatic surroundings skyline. The scale and size of them was something that struck him the most and with their cranes and flood lights mixed in with the ambient city lights, they eerily took on a sci-fi look and feel to them. This is when he started to first make images of the structures as he was travelling with his trusty companion, a large format 4x5 camera using sheet film.

Peter focuses on the graphic nature of the structure, as well as the “Cocoon” in its environmental surroundings of the distinct Hong Kong urban space. The name Cocoons for this series of works, felt a natural choice as these frameworks transform from an old and sometimes ugly building, wrapped in coloured material only to be unveiled like a Cocoon, to ceremoniously reveal a brand new building.

column9: Contemporary By Angela Li Gallery, G/F, 248 Hollywood Road, Sheung Wan
column19: Chen Jiagang - The Great Three Gorges
column37: The Three Gorges Dam is not only a monumental engineering achievement; it has bought us some undeniable world records. It is the biggest dam, power plant and largest consumer of dirt, stone, concrete and steel. But also, on top of that, this project is responsible for the displacement of in excess of 1.10 million people, suggested as one of the largest human resettlements in modern times.

column9: Haji Gallery, G/F, 12-14 Lok Ku Road, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong
column10: 上環樂古道12-14號夏至畫廊
column19: "Homework" Debut Photo-exhibition with Chet Lam Yat-Fung
column37: Chet Lam Yat-Fung is a renowned singer-songwriter in Hong Kong. Chet Lam’s debut photography exhibition, HAJI Gallery presents “Homework” by Chet Lam Yat-Fung, is a vision of music scene featuring very private moments of his journeys to different parts of the world. Being a multi-media artist, Chet’s projects not only include music, theatre and literature, but also photography. His exhibition is a “Travelog” of how a Hong Kong born local artist sees the world. His 12th album is also called “Homework”, this newly released work is the best of his recorded music marking his 10th anniversary in the music scene. There are three concepts behind “Homework”: the stories of Hong Kong, his travel thoughts, and the art of living. The photos he shot are closely tied with his music. Photography is definitely part of his music creative process. He brought all those thoughts from his journey and put them in his music, this is why he called the exhibition “homework”.
column38:
這次，音樂人林一峰在音樂，文字和舞台以外，用光影呈現他的世界；林一峰第一個個人相展＜家課＞，十多年來的遊歷，一個香港男孩將世界各地的光影捕捉，不可重複的畫面，停住時間的角度，用線條和比例交織一瞬即逝的觸動，你可能會驚訝發現，原來世界是這樣子

2011年林一峰的第十一張專輯＜ONE MAGIC DAY＞裡有一個主題：非關事件，而是看法；在展出的相片作品裡，其實都是用這個方法歸納編輯，畫面背後都有故事。不盡逍遙，也沒有重擔，就是邊走邊看，慢慢在世界每個角落感受。

林一峰的音樂專輯大多圍繞不同層面的旅行，而他的音樂作品十年選－與是次相片展同名的專輯＜家課＞，裡面有三個主題：香港故事，旅行思考，與及生活藝術，跟展出的相片絲絲緊扣，而且創作的過程也是一脈相承：在旅途中引發的思考，捕捉點滴，然後回到香港進行製作，好像做家課一樣；這個循環重複了好些年，亦成為了這位土生土長創作人的獨有標誌。

column9: Haji Gallery, G/F, 12-14 Lok Ku Road, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong
column10: 上環樂古道12-14號夏至畫廊
column19:
"AloneTogether"
Debut Photo-exhibition and book launch with Christopher Luk
column37:
In any place on earth, most of us are fond of being surrounded by friends or people we know. We socialize with others, party with friends and keeping ourselves busy to meet with people and get together. Humans are naturally social, and most of us sincerely cherish our friends, family, colleagues and people we know. Ironically though, a sentiment of loneliness may occur when we are playing, chatting, and partying together. Loneliness frequently occurs in busy cities, where some people feel utterly alone and cut off. Even when surrounded by many people, they feel lost and empty inside. Loneliness happens, when some of us simply pretend that we are part of the crowd, but are emotionally disengaged from such physical grouping. This is what Chris wants to bring out through photography in Alone Together. Conversely, being alone does not translate to loneliness. The pace of city life makes it difficult for us to appreciate the beauty of quietness and enjoy being alone. Communicating and connecting with one another is greatly appreciated but at the same time, there is so much to enjoy of being alone. Alone Together challenges the excessive social behavior in big cities and helps us find the balance between being social and appreciating the beauty of being alone.

Alone Together is different from other ‘city loneliness’ themed photography work that many great photographers have done before. Chris’s approach is to illustrate the emptiness inside people as opposed to capturing images of people being alone in a city physically. And the work presents the idea of loneliness when colleagues mingle at work, partying with friends at home, at bars, when people play together, and even in a dream. Instead of creating images of solitude, He brings out the emotion and feelings of the lonely city people through the expression of each model to illustrate the concept with a bit of twist to deliver the irony and contrasting moments.

column9: Haji Gallery, G/F, 12-14 Lok Ku Road, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong
column10: 上環樂古道12-14號夏至畫廊
column19: "Behind and Beyond" Debut Photo-exhibition and book launch with Vivian Wong
column20: 王賢詠《背後、往後》攝影展
column37:
About Vivian Wong “Each and Every photo is an expression of how I see the world”. Vivian Wong is both a loving spouse and a caring Mother, and amongst the many other activities present in her life, she devotes much of her time to photography. Her interest in photography became apparent ever since her early days of travel. Born in Hong Kong and then raised in Vancouver, Vivian experienced life between two contrasting sides of the world, and documented much of her memories through photography. She frequently travels to London, Shanghai and many other destinations. Vivian credits much of her traveling to have helped her develop an energetic eye for the camera, as well as an ability to observe and capture the world in her special perspective.


Proceeds of the Exhibition will be donated to Hong Kong Cancer Foundation.
column38:
“每一張相都是對世界體會的一種表達” 王賢詠是一位幸福的妻子，也是善解人意的母親，在各樣天職之下，她選擇把精神和時間投放於攝影。生於香港，長於加拿大溫哥華的王賢詠，經常遊走倫敦、上海及世界各地，她對攝影的熱愛始於早期旅遊時開始，到處捕捉世界的點滴。王賢詠把自己藏於相機內，把情緒放入鏡頭中，找到一種表達自己的方法，她對世界的體會從此不一樣。

透過王賢詠 Vivian 的鏡頭，捕捉門前窗後，細膩地反映女性超越陳規的渴望，以影像為女性發聲，展示風尚女性的獨立視野，改寫香港對女性以年齡、美貌、社會地位而出現的陳規化的形容詞，以相片展，重新厘定新女性概念。

column9: Haji Gallery, G/F, 12-14 Lok Ku Road, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong
column10: 上環樂古道12-14號夏至畫廊
column19: "Moon Pond: Reflections of China" Photo-exhibition with Jo Farrell
column37:
HAJI Gallery presents an exhibition of award winning photographer, Jo Farrell’s work in China, previously exhibited only in London and San Francisco. A selection of black and white documentary silver gelatin prints from a series taken in Anhui Province, China. These villages have maintained their traditional Qing and Ming dynasty buildings.

The signature photograph "Moon Pond" was selected as a finalist for "Best of Show" at the (AAF) Affordable Art Fair in London, 2004.

Hong_cun village was built in the Yongle Region of the Ming Dynasty and is shaped as an Ox. The natural fountain in the center of the village was made into a crescent shaped moon pond and is thought of as the Ox’s stomach. A 400-meter long canal was dug to bring a winding stream of water from the east to the west of the nearby river, and is described as the Ox’s intestines. There are four bridges that cross over the river to the village and make up the Ox’s legs. After completion of the village many of its’ residents left and became rich merchants and high officials. They returned to the village and brought their prosperity back with them. Today more than 50 buildings survive from the Ming and Qing Dynasties. The saying goes that “One generation plants the trees under whose shade another generation rests,” in Hong_cun village the special waterways have provided fresh clear spring water from which the residents raise fish and water the nearby fields—making them self-sufficient.

The village of XiDi was named after the local river. The village has over 120 Ming and Qing dynasty buildings, 3 main streets, 40 lanes / alleys, and is in the shape of a boat. All the roads are paved with slab stones and zigzag through the village. All the houses are two-storey buildings with grey brick walls, dark tile roofs and wooden structures. The Horse-Head walls that tower above the buildings are a recognizable feature of the village architecture.

column19: " Stand" The Solo Exhibition of Cheung Sze-lit
column20: 《觀看與被觀看》張施烈個人作品展
column37: The A‧lift Gallery 'CHECKPOINT' is pleased to present the solo exhibition of CHEUNG Sze-lit on December 2012. He was born in Mainland China, then moved to Hong Kong when he was a child. He has obtained a Bachelor Degree of Fine Arts at the Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology University. Sze-lit is now a full-time painter. Pencil drawing and oil painting are his main practice. He tends to observe and think about the relationship between himself, the surrounding people and environment. In this exhibition, he refers to Roland Barthes's "La Chambre claire: Note sur la Photographie", in which he uses Roland's concept on photographing as a base to investigate the relationship between seeing and being seen, the figure and the beholder. Using portrait photography as a blueprint, he tries to depict the reaction and condition of the figure.
column38: 提藝廊「CHECKPOINT」將於2012年12月舉辦張施烈個人作品展。張氏獲澳洲皇家墨爾本理工大學頒授藝術文學學位，現為全職畫家，其主要創作媒介為素描與油彩。他生於中國內地，兒時移居香港，兩地的生活、文化與價值觀念皆有所不同，驅使他自小觀察並思考他與周遭人與事的關係。是次展覽中，他以羅蘭巴特（Roland Barthes）在《明室‧攝影札記》中對攝影的概念，作為創作的探討，思考觀看者與被觀看者之間的關係，並用肖像攝影作為藍本，以素描及油彩描繪被攝者的反應與狀態。

column9: The Photocrafters,3/F Hang Fat Building, 140 Wing Lok Street, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong
column10: 上環永樂街140號恆發大廈三樓黑點
column37:
Hong Kong has exper­i­enced a tide of mass enthu­siasm for the works of Japanese pho­to­graphy master Daido Moriyama. Just at the moment of Moriyama’s cur­rent large-scale public exhib­i­tion and pho­to­graphy com­pet­i­tion, as well as his arrival for talks and sym­posia, The Photocrafters has dis­covered an anonymous pho­to­graphy master hitherto unknown to present in our second exhib­i­tion. His works are truly aston­ishing, more candid than Moriyama’s street shots and more instinctual than Cartier-Bresson’s Decisive Moment.

10,000 never-before-seen photos by this anonymous master will be unveiled, some in black and white printand some pro­jected in their uned­ited form. Visitors will dis­cover how post-production can give new meaning to pho­to­graphy and examine the role of ori­gin­ality and influ­ence in devel­oping an artistic voice.

This exhib­i­tion will be on dis­play at The Photocrafters’studio from November 4 to December 5. The anonymous artist will appear in person on November 18 for a public dis­cus­sion. Please don’t miss your chance to meet the artist and dis­cuss the exhib­ited works!

The series of photos may appear to be in the style of Moriyama, but in reality, they are a satir­ical cri­tique of works by those who blindly wor­ship and idolize pho­to­graphy icons. We hope that once vis­itors come to under­stand the motiv­a­tion behind this exhib­i­tion and the uncon­ven­tional equip­ment and pro­cess used, they will ree­valuate the praise given to ‘mas­ters’, the mim­icking of some mas­ters’ form and style, and the ped­estal upon which‘masters’ are placed. The exhib­i­tion aims to instigate a deeper reflec­tion of one’s rela­tion­ship to photography.

Can we truly “leave the forest” of Moriyama’s pho­to­graphic style? Or are the 10,000 photos exhib­ited merely farce? If they are nothing but a joke, what would you dis­cover when you look at Moriyama’ s work once again?
column38:
近年香港挖起了日本攝影大師森山大道的熱潮，從一眾的大型展覽， 攝影比賽，以致森山本人來港舉行講座及座談會。適逢此時，黑點在機緣巧合之下找來一個隱世埋名的攝影高手，這大師的作品絕對是驚為天人，其作品比森山大道的更率直，比布勒松的「決定性瞬間」更吊詭。

眼前除了呈現一系列高質量的黑白相片外，展覽中亦會投放全數一萬張未經編輯的大師作品！觀眾將體會到照片經後期編輯所帶出的新傳釋，體驗作品原有的角色和意味。

是次展覽期為11月4日至12月5日，我們邀請了該位隱世埋名的攝影大師於11月18日的研討會一展真身，各位請勿錯過!

一連串相片表面看似在重覆森山一貫的風格, 實際是向種種對偶像盲目祟拜的可笑現象作一次諷刺!當各位了解過是次展覽的動機, 意想不到的拍攝工具、過程和背後意義後， 觀者能擺脫大眾對「大師」的過份吹捧，從對其形式和風格上的沈溺裹走出來，抽或許離與「大師」的不同等位置，重新反思自身和攝影的關係。

且看能否「走出森山」?或本展的一萬張相片對你來說只是一堆笑話? 若是一則笑話，再重看森山大道的作品時，你又會看到什麼呢?

column37:
100 ft. PARK is pleased to present our inaugural exhibition Summer Killer from 23 August to 11 September 2012 which is also the first solo exhibition of Ada Hung.

Ada Hung has been interested in observing how people, especially Hong Kong people of this era, react to and confront with human desires in daily life. To emphasize that they are “civilized”, people often behave overly with self-restraint, suppressing their own emotions and even scrutinizing others’ feelings and desires. In a society where expects people to live with “moral responsibility”, we are told to act appropriately even though we have our own desires and needs. On view in this exhibition is a series of photographic works, objects and video work showing images of swimmers on the beach in summer; images that attract us but we dare not to look at openly! Audience is invited to liberate themselves from the social norms and immerse themselves in images of the human flesh.
column38:
百呎公園將於2012年8月23日至9月11日舉行我們的首個展覽《睇肉森林》，也是洪竹筠的首個個人展覽。

洪竹筠不斷觀察都市人在日常生活如何面對自己的慾望—尤其是這個時代的香港人，往往為了突顯自身的「文明」而過度自我克制；壓抑自己甚至監控別人的情感慾望。在一個高舉「道德責任」的社會裡，即使面對慾望也要表現得體。展覽透過展出的一系列攝影作品、物件和錄像，展現盛夏海灘上泳客的身影 – 引人視線卻又不敢注視的影像！希望觀眾能擺脫社會的規範，盡情投入肉體的森林。

column9: The Coming Society, Flat 2, LG 4, Kai Wong Commercial Building, 222 Queen's Road Central, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong
column10: 香港上環皇后大道丨22號啟煌商業大廈LG4/F 2室實現會社
column37: Architecture does not only construct the physical space that people live in, it also shapes our ways of life and the interaction between people. The government’s recent urban renewal schemes drastically change the outlook of the city. With old buildings demolished and renovated, new blocks built, the cityscape changes, so does the neighbourhood. Because of urban renewal, many inhabitants are forced to move out, old shops have to be closed down; most affected are the older generations, for what they lose are not only homes they have lived their entire lives, but also communities that they acquainted with. They mostly can no longer stay with the communities due to the unaffordable high prices of the new residences.Ramond HO captured the juxtapositions of the new and the old buildings in the process of urban renewal. New high-rise luxurious mansions stand out in the humble old houses, creating a peculiar city outline. Through photography, HO queries the objectives of urban renewal.
column38: 建築不僅直接影響人的生活空間，也間接影響著我們的生活模式、習慣及人與人之間的距離。近年政府的市區重建計劃對香港的城市風貌起了重大變化。舊樓清拆、重建和翻新改變了社區面貌，亦無形地改變了社區的脈絡。不少居民被迫搬遷，舊舖被迫結業，受影響的很多是上一代的老年人，他們遷離的不只是老家，而且是一個人情味濃郁的社區。而他們往往因為重建後的摩天「豪宅」價格高昂，不能在原區生活。何展兆拍攝了在舊區重建過程中新舊建築物共存的景象。新落成的「豪宅」高聳入雲，在舊平房中一柱擎天，令城市出現了奇特甚至畸形的景觀。何展兆透過這些影像反問市區重建的原意為何。

column37: Wailok, Janice Southpolep and South Ho explore the uncontrollability under manifested conditions and coincidences in the orderly everyday life in their works. In the process of creation, they examine the powerfulness and powerlessness of human. And associating with their life experiences, the process turns out to be therapeutic to them.Our life is full of fortuities. We call the accidental meetings of people and events coincidence. Things that we believe they are decided could be coincidences. Sunset and sunrise – natural phenomena that we expect day after day. From when does the sun accidentally set from the West but the East? And it happens every day? Repeated coincidences become permanence. What things are purely coincident in our daily life or are they only governed by certain laws, cycle and destiny? And what things are under our control as we believe?Wailok photographs images of shadows of tree leaves on different backgrounds. Through controlling the brightness and colour temperature in the process to create effects that human eyes can hardly distinguish. Wailok examines our sensitivity towards our surrounding and our cognitive ability. Since May 2009, Janice Southpolep has been shooting random imageries appeared in her daily life. Fortuitously, the series of photos is a reflection of her mental state. The accidental encountering of things seems planned; photographing has become her self-healing therapy. On photographs, South Ho draws narrow lines and tiny grids with pens of different colours to fill up the background. Because of the disharmony of the colouring materials, the brushstrokes become uneven, and colours merge and diffuse. The outcome becomes unpredictable. Ho experiments and experiences the unruliness even when things are under his control. The repeated experiment is a training for him.
column38: 張偉樂、張頌庭和何兆南透過作品探討在人類操控的環境中，一些不能控制的事情和結果，以及規律生活中事情的巧合。在創作的過程中，他們反覆思索人的力量與無力感，加上他們各自的經歷，探討和思考的過程變成對自己的治療。我們的日常生活裡充滿著偶然，人與事之間的相遇便是巧合。我們認為是冥冥中的事情，也可能只是巧合。日落和日出 ― 最恆常不過的自然現象。從何時起太陽巧合地從西方落下，而非東方？而且日復日？巧合不斷的重複，成為恆常。而我們的生活中，有多少事情是純粹的偶然，還是我們逃不過既有的定律、循環和命運？又有多少事情是如我們所想般可以控制？張偉樂拍攝了在不同背景上的樹葉倒影，在相片製作過程間，透過控制光的明暗與色溫，營造人類肉眼不能看出的視覺，探索人們對周邊事物的敏感度和認知能力。自2009年，張頌庭無間斷地隨意的拍下在生活中出現的瑣碎事。一系列隨心的照片卻成為了她的心靈寫照，偶然事物的出現變得像是早有安排，拍攝成為自我痊癒的方法。何兆南用顏色筆在現成的照片上，以線條和細格把背景填滿。由於上色物料的不協調，出現筆觸不一，顏色重疊、滲開，效果變得不可預料。何兆南探討和經歷在他控制範圍下不能控制的結果，重複的試驗也成為他個人的鍛鍊。

column9: V13 Vodka Bar, G/F, 13 Old Bailey Street, SoHo, Central, Hong Kong
column19: "Explore the Dark Side" a solo iPhone photography show by Oscar Venhuis
column38:
EXPLORE THE DARK SIDE

A black and white journey through Hong Kong

已經聽過很多說法：「相機只是工具，照片的內涵才是靈魂。」
這個道理應不用多辨。
可以帶給觀看者有多一重的想像，深一層的思考，這張照片的價值才會提升
於是這個有趣的攝影展便更值得一看。

由 Oscar Venhuis用他的隨身手機iphone，拍攝出他眼中的香港中環面貌
雖然每張相片都是你我皆熟悉的中環街景
但oscar卻令這些早已被香港人習以為常的景象添上新鮮的角度
用照片配上平面設計，延伸照片的閱讀性，是這個展覽作品最令人驚喜之處

每天被踏遍數千的石屎街，被oscar以一個新穎方法呈現出來
頓時覺得那補完又補的石屎街道，多了可愛味
中環恆生銀行總行對出的行人天橋，
摩登但格格不入的連上對面基乎空置的街市
在oscar的i phone內，卻又變得有如stanley kubrick太空漫遊的場景一樣

Oscar令中環看似不一樣，其實就如他所言：
“The impression of Hong Kong is that it is a fast-moving and manic city,” says Oscar, “however, my photos show a different side of Hong Kong. Amidst the hustle and bustle is a serene urban oasis. This On-The-Go collection invites the viewer rediscover the mystifying contours of Hong Kong.”

拍攝，從來都只是你和拍攝對象的關係，而非景深的遠近。
拍攝，從來都只是靠眼睛，而非靠鏡頭；

column37: SHANGRI-LA – the name of the utopian lamasery described by novelist James Hilton in his 1933 novel, Lost Horizon, summons visions of a magical city floating high above the earth, hidden away amidst towering mountains, where the secret of eternal peace, youth and happiness might be found. While many places have claimed the honor and the name, there is no doubt the mysterious kingdom of Tibet and its outlying regions in western China were Hilton’s inspiration for Shangri-La.

column20: 傑羅姆‧邦尼特 鏡頭下的電影明星攝影展
column37: Every single day during the Paris Cinema International Film Festival, French photographer Jérôme Bonnet immortalises the visits of the guests including international artists and directors, featuring the extravaganza’s guests “in action”. Bonnet establishes his award-winning career by taking strong and captivating pictures that offer different angles on much-photographed celebrities, while remaining commercial enough to secure regular editorial press exposure. Bonnet thrives on creating images of the celebrities different to the ones already taken. The trick, not easy at all, is to capture provocative original portraits without scaring the celebrities away.
column38: 著名法國攝影師傑羅姆‧邦尼特 (Jérôme Bonnet) 在巴黎國際電影節期間，捕捉嘉賓的姿態，現場動態和花絮，以「Movie Stars」為題拍攝一系列相片，當中包括國際巨星和導演。屢獲殊榮的邦尼特能捕捉名人不同的角度，以拍攝出感染力強的動人寫真見稱，並且不失相片對報章雜誌的報導價值，因而見報率甚高，享負盛名。獨具慧眼的他技術出神入化，能把已被攝獵無數次的名人用鏡頭將其無人捕捉過的一面顯示出來。

column37: Chan Yu’s work commands a standing in the contemporary art world because of both their meaning and presentation. Chan Yu’s previous series was heavily centered on his own concept of identity. His 2008 solo in Connoisseur Contemporary titled “The Absence of Self; The Presence of Images”, required him to see himself from a third-person perspective and subsequently look at another person as himself; in order to establish his identity. In the end he believes that our identity is affirmed by the presence of others and that often, we are just trying on alter egos to see which fits best. His work is now recognizable by his style of repetitive, overlapping layering of images that have become a symbol of his evolution as a person and as an artist with a complex personality.

column37:
Tian Taiquan has created series of conceptual photos out of his childhood memory during Cultural Revolution in Chongqing. The artist, born in the most peculiar period in the modern history of China, is greatly attentive to social issues and hence, develops the Trilogy “Past, Present; Future”. He aims to respond and raise awareness in the society with his artworks. It is claimed as the responsibility of an artist. “Totem Recollection” highlights the most renowned “Past” series of the Trilogy.

http://artexperiencegallery.com/totem-recollection/

column37:
Picasso is one of the most influential figures in the 20th century art history. His art works include oil paintings, drawings, sculptures, collages, and ceramics etc. He is one of the few artists who can be both prolific and financially successful throughout the life time. His success is based on all the art techniques and theory trainings that he acquired in his young age. Picasso and Georges Braque developed cubism painting style which revolutionized the field of art and moved him up in the world. As a result, he has become extremely prominent and valuable artist in the century.

It is the biggest Picasso exhibition ever held in the Hong Kong Heritage Museum. In total 55 paintings will be displayed. Including well-known pieces such as “La fillette aux pieds nus (The barefoot girl),” “Le sculpteur (The Sculptor),” and “Portrait de Dora Maar (Portrait of Dora Maar).” His other works that closely related to his personal life, “Femme assise dans un fauteuil rouge (Woman sitting on a red chair),” and more will be displayed as well.

In order to honor this incredible event, 20 carefully selected silkscreen printed Picasso prints copies which authorized by Picasso Foundation will be available for sale to the public. Hong Kong will only get 50 limited sets. And these sets are representing Picasso' s matured printing skills on both traditional and cubism, which is valuable for arts learning. This set uses high quality printmaking paper, Arches 88. And every piece of paper contains Picasso’s signature and the authorization parties’ watermark and numbered edition. It is of high collection and appreciation value.

An exhibition of these 20 copies will be hold at ArtOne, Wanchai. We are looking forward to seeing you at the exhibition.
column38:
畢卡索做為20世紀現代藝術的主要代表人物之一，作品包括油畫、素描、雕塑、拼貼、陶瓷等。畢卡索是少數能在生前「名利雙收」的畫家之一。基於從幼年時期習得的傳統繪畫功力，和對藝術理論的研究，他與喬治．布拉克共同創建立體派運動，他的革命新藝術成就為他贏得聲譽，亦使他成為本世紀最著名和最有價值的藝術家。

此次香港文化博物館將迎來本港有史以來最大型的畢加索展覽，共有五十五件風格多樣化的畢加索遺作。除《赤腳女孩》、《雕塑家》以及《朵拉．瑪爾畫像》這些耳熟能詳的作品外，還有與畢加索的人生起伏緊密相關的畫作，如《坐在紅色座椅上的女人》等具有特殊私密性的作品。

為紀念畢加索和此次前無來者的大型展覽，經法國畢加索基金會授權，特別選取的能代表畢加索不同時期的創作風格的20幅畢加索複製版畫以限量50套在香港地區發售。其中可以看到畢加索成熟的傳統繪畫風格，也有他獨特的立體風格作品，特別適合藝術創作者作為學習和參考之用。此套作品特別採用法國進口的 ARCHES88 版畫紙，有畢加索簽名浮水印、畢加索中國組委會的浮水印以及序列號，非常具有紀念和收藏價值。

此套成品將與5月15日-30日在灣仔ArtOne藝術廣場做專題展覽，敬請品鑒。

column37: Sculptor Danny Lee demonstrated his global perspective by his constant observation on tiny existences in nature, which their humble and ordinary appearances were captured and enlarged. Sowing Seeds at the Hong Kong Arts Centre symbolised the art genes being cultivated to excellent crop yields in the coming future.
column38: 藝術家李展輝愈來愈關注近在身邊的微細事物，近年不少作品都是將自然界的事物放大，令平凡甚至卑微的現象受到注目，從中體現創作人的世界觀。《種子》在藝術中心的地下大堂出現，象徵在此空間種下的藝術基因，在灌溉下成長，將來結成美好成果。

column37: "I don’t want to be memorised, I just want to live on.My appearance is for appealing to your conscience.”Mok Yat-san’s sculpture of a polar bear stepping on a melting ice calls for us to pay attention to the current crises of the bears and mother nature.
column38:
「我不要被紀念，只想仍可繼續生活下去。
我出現在當下，只為碰觸你良知的神經。」
由著名藝術家莫一新創作，凹凸紋相間的北極熊腳踏溶冰，喚起公眾對北極熊以至大自然面臨的生存危機的關注。

column37: Artist Danny Lee Chin-fai creates a three dimensional sculptural painting, illustrating his thoughts over the two topics: “City” and “Landscape”.  At the same time, the visitors are invited to slow down their pace from the hustle and bustle, to travel and enjoy with the artist, so as to contemplate what we have grown in our own city.
column38: 藝術家李展輝以雕塑作一幅立體的都市山水，除了表達他對「都市」和「山水」兩個課題的思考外，亦邀請觀眾在繁忙的生活中稍作歇息，以輕鬆的心情一同遊山玩水，細想我們在都市中所栽下的一切。

column38:
我們在創造雕塑的同時, 雕塑同樣雕塑着我們

從二零零二年香港藝術學院有了第一屆雕塑文憑畢業生。
來到二零一二年剛好十個年頭，兩年前我們有了第一屆以雕塑為主修科目的學位畢業生，從當年的東成大厦到現在的JCCAC，學生從當初甚麼都不懂去學習雕塑，同時亦從雕塑的過程中雕塑了日後個人的成長。

是次展的十位藝術家分別來自已畢業及本年度剛畢業的畢業生和仍在就讀的同學。我們經常說教育是一種制度，有趣的是，在同一制度下各人從自身的背景、歷練，各自研習出一套屬於自己的雕塑語言。當中有人幹着與藝術無關的工作， 有人當了藝術家的助手，有人專注藝術行政，藝術導師及全職藝術家，若然雕塑是從物料出發，造形，再把其能量轉化。 相信…人生亦然。

column37: “Hotpot” is a dinning style embraced by a great number of Chinese everywhere in China. In hotpot, we all sit together in a round table as a union, cook together, eat together and chat together. The cultural and symbolic meaning of hotpot for the intimate exchanges amongst a group of friends is essential in this program. “Art Hotpot” will be a platform for the Hong Kong and Polish artists in this exchange program to experience art together, make art together, and chat about art together.

column19: The Last Turner of Prince Edward
column37:
Chi Shing Turner was an old shop run by Mr Leung King-fan who had been a local carpenter for over 50 years. With the changes of time and the advance of the technology, the industry of carpentry which involves complicated process and traditional craftsmanship has been declining. Chi Shing Tunrer in Prince Edward closed down in Dec 2012. Seeing that, design team Yuen Yeung held an exhibition about this old shop in the district.

Jointly presented by 100ft. PARK and Yuen Yeung, the extended exhibition Chi Shing Turner will show photos of Mr Leung King-fan at work, his works and his tools. Though large machines went sent abroad already, Mr Leung King-fan still keeps some of the small tools. On view also includes works created by members of Yuen Yeung.
column38:
「志成車木」是梁景勳先生在「車木」(木匠工藝)行業經營了50年在九龍太子的老店。隨著時代轉變，這種工序繁複的傳統技術已經息微。2012年12月，位於太子的「志成車木」正式結業。有見及此，設計團隊「Yuen Yeung 駌鴦」曾在該區舉辦了一個有關這老店的展覽。

是次「百呎公園」與設計團隊「Yuen Yeung 駌鴦」合作舉辦「志成車木」延續展覽，展出梁景勳先生工作情況的照片、作品和用具。雖然大型機器已送到國外，但梁景勳先生仍保留部份小工具。展覽同時亦會展出「Yuen Yeung 駌鴦」成員創作的作品。

column37: Speaking of re-creation, it may remind you of funny parody images on web, the Copyright (Amendment) Bill in 2011, or some controversy on the issue. Have you ever thought about why some folks keep making re-creation, even if it may abuse the copyright law? What is so special about re-creation? Why don’t they just create their original?
column38: 甚麼是二次創作？你可能會聯想起網上惡搞改圖、改歌，然後想起去年的版權條例修訂草案，或一些相關的爭議事件。然而你有沒有想過，為甚麼有些人仍然堅持進行二次創作？二次創作的特性是甚麼？為甚麼不原創？

column19: The Yellow River Has Nine Corners
column37: Merel is an independent Belgian painter who expresses herself in bold colours and textures, laced with symbols, numbers and words. Her paintings radiate warmth and speak of joyful encounters, good fortune and happiness, reading more like music than two-dimensional works. Merel’s language isn’t tied to a particular country or culture but crosses borders as it speaks of life and love – feelings people can relate to universally.

column37: The time he takes for each painting and thus the patience required for anyone else sitting as a model, limits him almost exclusively to self-portraits or those of his immediate family. column37: Out of the many festivals and holidays in Vietnam, Tet, the traditional New Year celebration, is probably everyone’s favorite. Pink peach trees in full blossom, orchids and kumquat (derived from the Cantonese word gam gwat ) trees, full of fruit, in huge pots decorate the homes Work comes to a standstill, shops close only this time of the year and there’s a sense of excitement in the air as kids and adults alike take to streets, visit friends and relatives and party for days on end leading up to the New Year.

column37: Yet, Yu goes further. Beyond the technical skils she displays, there is a deeply curious yound woman at work, interested in unveiling the complex human psyche of her chosen models. On canvas the setting is purposely simplistic, the models sexy and alluring. Yet the real focus of each work, beyond each almost hypnotic gaze, is the intricate emotion, the reality beyond our initial perceptions that give these works their extraordinary power.

column36: 潘蔚然,時永駿,許劍豪,劉珮瑤
column37: Artists are always sensitive to the particularity of the daily routine, their attempt to search for the hidden events – sometimes banality in others’ perspective – is to regard all the tiny tracks and to transform them through their way of interpretation. By colors, by texture, or by form, in each moment of creation, their way of existence is reflected by their sincerity toward the canvas also as much as the religious repetition that would bond the artists and audiences together through the hidden beauty of the daily life. The four artists with various backgrounds here will share their “usefulness” but extremely peaceful and reflexive thoughts in this exhibition...

column37: Whether it is through his “silhouettes” paintings or his much acclaimed videos such as ‘Abba Mao’, ‘Axes of Evil’ and ‘Savoir Aimer’, Pascal Lièvre (born in 1963 in Lisieux, France) re-appropriates himself icons of pop culture and mixes them to create a new language. He constantly scraps out famous historical art works from all their geometrical structure and background in his paintings, keeping only the main character’s silhouette(s) to produce new minimalist, updated, familiar yet puzzling works. His paintings are a reflection on the History of Art as well as about all things we may take for granted, seeing them always from the same angles but once these angles change, then we will discover a whole new world.

column19: Flux: The Contemporary Woodcut by Katasutoshi Yuasa
column20: Flux: The Contemporary Woodcut by Katasutoshi Yuasa
column37: Tokyo-based artist Katsutoshi Yuasa’ s work has been shown widely around the world, and is currently exhibited in London, New York and Berlin. Flux consists of monolithic woodcuts never before seen in Hong Kong. The exhibition explores the fundamental theme of nature in the artist’s works and is curated in two sections; the first explores nature in its moving, unstable force and the second in man-made environments or artificial interventions in nature.  Although these are themes that have preoccupied Yuasa for much of his career, they have gained significance in light of the traumatic natural disaster on 11th March 2011 in Japan.  Beneath the visually romantic images, the show reveals an elegiac technique that portrays not so much a pessimistic but almost a mournful understanding and perception of man and nature in today’s society.

column37:
223 (a.k.a Lin Zhi Peng) and Ren Hang both utilize the photographic medium as an essential means to express individualism and existential concerns. By portraying their own generation in modern day China, their images reflect the spontaneous and random living conditions in the subculture. Their images blur the boundaries between private and public by displaying their own intimate lives and close acquaintances, showcasing different aspects from drug and alcohol consumption, sex, homosexuality to bodily media. 

Despite their visual similarities, works of 223 and Ren Hang are constructed very differently. 223’s snapshot aesthetic spontaneously documents his subjects in the everyday, offering clues to his own lifestyle choices. In contrast to 223, Ren Hang’s carefully constructed staged photography (in some cases pretending to be snapshot) is more ambiguous with the subject devoid of any sense of self. At times the work is exploitative and highly fetishistic, provoking an immediate emotional response; at other times it is abstract and minimalistic, inviting a quiet contemplation.
column38:
223（林志鵬）與任航均以攝影作為表達對個人與存在主義的藝術媒介。透過描繪當今中國社會屬於他們的一代人，兩位藝術家的影像反映了生活態度即興及隨性的次文化，影像中活力與陰鬱的情調相互對比。他們的作品亦呈現了自己及身邊友人的私密生活，並將日常瑣事灌以意義，模糊了私人照片和公眾影像之間的界線。 

雖然如此，二人的創作手法及風格卻大相逕庭。223以快拍手法即興地捕捉生活的日常，他的影像暴露了他個人的生活方式。相反，任航的作品卻是刻意鋪排的編導式攝影 (即使他有時會裝作快拍)。影像中的主題或人物的意向模糊並缺乏自我意識。時而，影像具被虐或戀物的意味，激起觀者的即時情緒反應: 時而，影像則抽象和簡約，引領觀者進入沈思。

column38: 2013年1月10日至21 日，六位香港藝術家赴印度孟買，參與由當地組織: Art Oxygen(暫譯為「藝術氧氣」)主辦，題為「[en]counters 2013: PowerPLAY」的藝術活動。Encounter 意為遇上、遭遇。主辦單位特意將[en]放在括號中，刻意請觀者留意字的組成包含了「counter」（意為對立、 反擊）。隱喻希望透過藝術，讓社會中不同的對立面互相溝通、了解。

column37:
Fabrik is pleased to present a solo exhibition of new works by Vito Hung Fai entitled 'Variation'. Born in Hong Kong in 1988, Hung Fai has developed a deep interest in painting since childhood. Experimenting with both Chinese and Western media, he re-interpreted ‘Ink Art’ and developed a unique way of presenting techniques both in paper and canvas. ‘Variation – a plan of restoration’ features a series of work on paper, in which a variation of life was nurtured using water as ‘flesh’ and ink as ‘bones’. Hung Fai examines abstract organisms, to investigate the value embedded deeply in bodies and the possibilities of life. The series works are created based on the concept and language developed by the artist to record changes in life by restoring human form to the most primitive stage. The inspiration comes from penetration of x-rays through folding a surface (Chinese paper) multiple times where a three-dimensional ‘container’ is created. With the sensitive nature of Chinese paper and special techniques, ink injected penetrates, appears, duplicates and accumulates. The unfolded piece reveals chapters of transformation traces - a music score, notating the journey of bodies and the variation of life.
Since 2011, Vito has been awarded the Ting Yen Yung Award at The Art of CUHK and has
received the Wucius Wong Modern Ink Painting Award at The Art of CUHK in 2012. His work was selected as one of the finalists of Hong Kong Young Artist Prize in 2012.

column37: The exhibition “Jaffa Lam Laam Collaborative: Weaver”, to be held from 19th Jan to 7th Feb 2013, will display a number of sculptures and installations that highlight the art direction and philosophy of the artist’s participation in various foreign and local exhibition in the past five years. Focusing on a specific kind of interaction between art and the community, the exhibition brings audience a rich backdrop of culture, history, the society and current issues. In the exhibition, Lam collaborates with different local groups and creative personnel, including the Hong Kong Women Workers’ Association and Sun Shing Wooden Box Co.. Lam’s approach to use secondary materials such as, fabric taken from a used umbrella or the wooden planks taken from a crate, criticizes and re-establishes and the role of art in the community. Utilizing the unique space in the Pao Galleries of the Hong Kong Arts Centre, Lam is going to provide visitors with a unique visual experience using materials of different forms and textures, and interplay of light and shadow. Behind the physical appearances lies the artist’s reflection of self identity and her opinion on art
column38: 《林嵐合作社 – 織織復織織》將於一月十九日至二月七日於香港藝術中心包氏畫廊舉行。觀眾透過展出的雕塑及裝置藝術，可以了解到香港藝術家林嵐於過去五年來，在海外及本地多次展覽的創作成果。林嵐的作品經常以文化歴史、社會及時事為背景。是次展覽的創作中，林嵐邀請了香港婦女協會及新城木箱兩個社區團體參與創作，主要以回收得來的物料例如舊傘子的面布、木箱或卡板木等，重新建立以及思考藝術在社會的功能。另外，林嵐亦就著藝術中心包氏畫廊獨特的空間設計，特意悉心佈置，採用不同材質和形態的物料，安排交錯的光影，務求讓觀者得到獨一無二的視覺體驗; 而令人目不暇給的物象背後，其實蘊含著製作者對自身、對藝術的反思。

column37: Paintings of Elena are expressive, simple and innocent. column37: Yutaka Makino’s Temporal Object #2, a sound installation, investigates the acoustic nature of space. In this piece, the space gradually fills up with sound so that its acoustic nature becomes unperceivable to the visitor. During this process, the resonant space gradually disappears and the body comes into focus. The installation guides visitors to experience a visceral and immersive type of listening as they encounter a continuous folding and unfolding of acoustic and spatial features.

column37: What can you normally find on a wall? A clock, a picture, a poster, or a decorative pattern of the wallpaper? Through the group exhibition, students of our Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art) programme, (majoring in Ceramics) broke the routine of displaying ceramics by using the space on the wall of The Gallery of Hong Kong Art School instead of a horizontal platform to showcase their ceramics artworks, allowing viewers to appreciate their creative ceramics artworks from a different perspective.
column38: 你平時在牆上會找到什麼？一個掛鐘、一幅圖畫、一張海報、還是牆紙上的圖案？香港藝術學院藝術文學士課程之學生(主修陶藝)，透過是項展覽打破展示陶藝的慣例，用學院藝廊的牆壁去取代橫向平台以展示其一系列的陶藝作品，讓觀眾從不同角度欣賞他們具有創意的陶藝作品。

column37: “We love art; we love painting; we love everything beautiful and believe true beauty lies in honesty.”－Teresa Lee and Vicki Chung. 　Under the guidance of their master Ng Chung, the two alumni of Hong Kong Art School’s painting short courses showcased the results of their art learning in the past seven years in the group exhibition. Through the exhibition, they shared their joy of painting and exchange opinions with viewers.
column38: 「我們喜歡藝術，我們喜歡繪畫，我們喜歡美麗的事物並確信真正的美只有在誠實中找到。」──李皓華、鍾碧玉。在她們的老師吳松的悉心指導下，兩位香港藝術學院短期課程之舊生將於展覽中展出她們過去七年之藝術學習成果。透過展覽，她們與觀眾分享其繪畫之喜樂以及交流意見。

column37:
We are living in an era of the ever changing media and technology. We can see the virtual world when we are roaming in the culture. Is there any difference between our belief, perception and the truth? 

What kind of association hidden inside a cloud in a digitalized era?

This was an exhibition with unique visual experience in the real world and the internet.
column38:
我們生活在媒體與科技的變遷裡，在文化的漫遊中看虛擬。

我們看到的、相信的，和真實之間，會有差異嗎？

這是一個在數碼化的年代，雲裡藏著甚麼的聯想。

這個展覽帶給公眾一個真實世界與網絡的視覺體驗。

column35: Tadanori Yokoo, Takashi Murakami and Koichi Sato etc.
column36: 横尾忠則、村上隆和佐藤晃一等
column37:
Toshusai Sharaku was the most remarkable ukiyo-e artist from Edo Period in Japan. During his short-lived artistic career in the late 18th century, he produced over 140 works of woodblock printing in the span of 10 months.

 

This exhibition reinterprets Sharaku’s style in different parts – reprints of Sharaku’s most highly acclaimed single series of bust portraits from the Edo Kabuki and Kyogen plays in 1794 will be shown alongside related striking posters by graphic designers of our time. About 80 portraits and installations by 39 Japanese prominent artists, including Tadanori Yokoo, Takashi Murakami and Koichi Sato, will be shown to pay tribute to the ukiyo-e master via artistic creation, while at the same time demonstrate how Japanese contemporary art, design and comics are extended from the aesthetics of traditional Japanese woodblock printing.
column38:
東洲斎寫樂是日本江戶時代最具代表性的浮世繪畫家。寫樂在其藝術生涯最活躍的十八世紀後期，在短短十個月時間內創作超過一百四十幅浮世繪畫作。

是次展覽將透過不同層面展現寫樂風格，平行展示從1794年江戶的歌舞伎及狂言藝人畫像複刻版畫到現代平面設計師的海報設計。展覽將展出近八十件平面及立體作品，由三十九位日本殿堂藝術家和設計師包括横尾忠則、村上隆和佐藤晃一等，以藝術創作向這位浮世繪大師致敬，同時展現日本當代藝術、設計和漫畫如何延續日本經典的版畫美學。

column19: One Country Two Creations Joint Exhibition
column35: Fan Mingzheng, Kang Haitao, Ling Chin Tang Parry, Shen Liang, Tsang Chui Mei, Vivian Poon, Wu Haizhou
column37: Mainland China has the implementation of socialism with Chinese characteristics and democratic centralism. The socialist system and policies shall not be practiced in Hong Kong, and the previous capitalist system and way of life shall remain unchanged. For Hong Kong, except defense and foreign affairs, we can have the right of high degree of autonomy and to participate in international affairs. This is known as the “Hong Kong people ruling Hong Kong and a high degree of autonomy”. Growing up in such a different environment and education, artists from China and Hong Kong will nurture different artistic concepts and content of expression. This time, VA Gallery presents a joint exhibition of “One Country Two Creations” which highlights the two differences of art and culture.

column20: 御畫園·古今名畫複制品大展
column37: This exhibition will showcase the masterpieces in ancient and modern times, including ‘Riverside Scene at Qingming Festival’ by Zhang Ze-duan from the Northern Song era, Chiu Ying from Ming Dynasty and from National Palace Museum, Taipei. These masterpieces show the cityscape and social life in these three dynasties. There are nearly 200 paintings from Tang, Song, Yuan, Ming and Qing dynasty which are available for us to see the greatest artistic achievements in its two thousand years of history in China. As most of the original artworks are being collected by cross-strait national museums, we can seldom see more at one time. Therefore, Wan Fung specially organizes this art prints exhibition in order to reproduce the elegance of a number of ancient and modern art masters. Art lovers can feel so close to the charm of the Chinese national treasures. The ancient Chinese painting and calligraphy is undoubtedly the most precious cultural heritage in China. However, it is extremely difficult to save these works in a good quality in long term. As a result, many rare collections are not easily exhibited to the public. The emergence of high-precision replication technology allows us to save the original elegance of the ancient and modern paintings these years. The quality of these art prints is not only comparable to the original one; the colors even can be stored for centuries, which become the ideal home decorations of art lovers.

column37: Hou Xi is a young abstract artist from Chengdu, South West China. The smoothly curved lines of her paintings are inspired by Chinese ink paintings, but her tools are not the Chinese Ink brush and rice paper but the contemporary media of acrylic and oil on canvas. The curved lines, encompassing complementary fields of colour construct a complex and dazzling composition, conveying a sense of of constant movement.

column20: 工友作品集] 藝術專修課程2012-13結業展
column37: The Art Specialist Course 2012-13 is coming to an end, a group of enthusiastic young artists with different background has completed 10 months of intensive art training in painting, printmaking and sculpture. The courses were co-ordinated by Mr Li You-mang, Ms Liu Siu-jane and Mr. Lee Chin-fai and taught by many renowned artists. How is the result of their learning? In this exhibition, you will not only be able to communicate with these new artists and enjoy these refreshing art pieces, but also to have a glimpse of the contemporary art scene!
column38: 2012至2013年度的藝術專修課程即將完結，一班有熱誠、來自五湖四海的年輕藝術家經歷了十個月的密集式藝術訓練，在由李尤猛先生、廖少珍女士、李展輝先生及其他資深藝術家的教授和分享下，分別完成繪畫、版畫及雕塑三項課程。學習的成果如何豐盛？在今次展覽中，您不但能和這批新進藝術家交流，欣賞到這批令人耳目一新的藝術品，更能一睹當代藝術的概貌！

column10: 火炭山尾街華樂工業中心D座17 樓 41室
column37: I showed a public art in Fotanian Open Studios last year (2012). Audience could write down their views about what rape is. In the beginning, I worried that no one would respond. Surprisingly, I got a lot of responses (140+) within 4 days. These responses enriched the work. Not only the issue of sexual assault was discussed, myths of sexual assault were exposed and the topic was integrated into the daily life: rape refers to all sorts of things which others are forced to do. These responses inspired me to do a new work about a wider definition of rape.
column38: 去年(2012) 我在伙炭開放日展出一件公共藝術，讓觀眾發表「強姦是(甚麼)？」的意見， 有約百四個留言或圖。這些回應令作品變得豐富，不單討論了性侵犯的議題，暴露了性侵犯的迷思，更將議題帶到日常生活上，將強姦泛指成各樣強迫他人做不願意的事情。觀眾的回應啟發我做新一件有關廣義強姦的作品。

column19: From Studium to Punctum — Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art) Graduation Exhibition 2012
column20: 從知面到刺點──藝術文學士畢業展2012
column29: Hong Kong Art School, The Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology University
column30: 香港藝術學院、澳洲皇家墨爾本理工大學
column37: Titled From Studium to Punctum, the Graduation Exhibition of the Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art) programme will be held this July, showcasing the artworks of thirty-nine graduates in diverse media including painting, ceramics, photography, sculpture, and multimedia installation.  In his book Camera Lucida, Roland Barthes applies the twin concepts of “studium” and “punctum” on photography.  Studium denotes the cultural, linguistic, and political interpretation, while punctum depicts the wounding, personally touching detail.  The duality of these cohesive forces offers dynamic possibilities as the graduates focused on the exploration between general interpretations and distinctive visions.  There will be guided tours for secondary schools, interested parties please call 2824 5371 for reservation.
column38: 一年一度的藝術文學士畢業展即將舉行，是次展覽以「從知面到刺點」為主題，共展出三十九位應屆畢業生匯集不同創作媒介包括繪畫、陶藝、攝影、雕塑和多媒體裝置藝術的畢業作品。羅蘭‧巴特於其著作《明室》中，以「知面」和「刺點」描述攝影的雙概念。「知面」意指影像的敍事面，而「刺點」則是刺穿「知面」的一個缺口。課程畢業生在藝術創作中，遊走於這雙概念之間，從普遍性認知層面的「知面」裡尋求「刺點」以展現藝術上的獨到見解，觸動觀眾隱藏於內心深處的一點刺。展覽將設有中學導賞團，有興趣的學校可致電2824 5371預約。

column20: 單車電影節（香港站）: 攝影及古董單車展覽
column29: Sport b., Artistic Partners: Hong Kong Arts,Flwride
column30: Sport b.、 創意伙伴：香港藝術中心、Flwrider
column37: One of the highlights of the Festival will be the Exhibition of Vintage and Rare Bicycles, which will be held from 11 to 25 January. Over 35 rare and beautiful bicycles from Hong Kong and international collectors will be showcased, each reflecting the personality and aesthetic taste of its owner and builder. This is the kind of exhibition you do not see every day.
column38: Agnès b.、Flwrider及香港藝術中心在二零一三年一月，終於把單車電影節帶到香港！其中作為電影節的一部份，在一月十一至二十五日更會展出懷舊及罕見的 單車藏品。來自香港及世界各地，超過35架珍貴單車完全反映出其擁有者及製造者的個性和品味，平日我們看不到的獨有風味特色，將毫無保留地盡現眼前。
