column19: I'm perfect Auction Works Preview Exhibition
column20: 「我圓我夢」殘疾人士展藝計劃慈善拍賣預展
column35: TWGHs Jockey Club Rehabilitation Complex Inclusive Art Hub
column36: 東華三院賽馬會復康中心藝聚畫社
column37:
Art can enrich one’s life. Through art, dream can be realized and being “imperfect”. A group of service users from the Tung Wah Group of Hospitals, who are also art lovers, spare no efforts to learn calligraphy, drawing and painting. Despite their physical limitations, they strive hard to make their dreams come true.
TWGHs is keen on promoting artworks of disabled artists in the community. Treasure Auctioneer Limited shares the same vision. Their joint effort has brought into existence the charity auction of paintings and Chinese calligraphy. The proceeds will mainly be used to support disabled artists to move towards self-reliance.
Encouragement helps realize others’ dream. We look forward to your support to this meaningful initiative.
column38:
藝術能豐富人的生命。透過藝術，也可圓夢；把原來不完全的，變得完美。
一群在東華三院接受服務的人士，因為熱愛藝術，即使能力不同，仍每天樂活在實現夢想的路上，努力不懈地學習繪畫及書法。
為了讓他們的作品有機會被賞識，在富得拍賣行的支持下，東華三院現透過「我圓我夢」殘疾人士展藝計劃，舉辦一項畫作和書法的慈善拍賣會。拍賣所得善款，將主要用作協助殘疾人士自力更生。
「一筆一畫，一心一夢；藝可展能，賞能續夢！」您的欣賞和支持能夠成就別人的夢想。

column19: Consanguineous dialog / The dialog between me and her…

Fabrik Contemporary Art @ ART ONE
Gallery 12, M/F, Convention Plaza, 1 Harbour Road, Wan Chai, Hong Kong
column10: ART ONE, 香港會議及展覽中心
column19: Consanguineous dialog / The dialog between me and her…
column37:
The
exhibition will feature a video installation in three frames with accompanying photo stills.
In the video presented in a continuous loop of monochromatic black and white, Lau's narrative describes the relationship between four characters ("me and three
females, which are my mother, my wife and my daughter") through a series of still
images to recreate moving motion. "I believe that motions can express and reveal
more information than language. Body language is more real and delicate. Having black and white as the two colors that dominate the work relates to the linear relationship from one generation to the next. This inherently contains an element of historical and memorial."

column19: Ädel Metall [ Precious Metal ] Exhibition of Unique Objects and Jewellery by Swedish Artists
column37:
An exhibition showcasing precious metal work and jewellery by a group of Swedish artists, who share the passion for the same material, expressed in 7 different personalities. 
The artists’ works are displayed in Hong Kong for the first time, presenting unique Scandinavian design and craftsmanship. The exhibition consists of silver object such as candle stand and bowls, which are handmade with distinctive detailing. It also showcases jewellery which are contemporary in style, expressing different conceptual ideas that are close to the artists’ hearts.
This group of artists is well-recognized in Scandinavia, with their works represented in major museums and galleries in the region, including The National Museum in Stockholm.

column37:
Kwok has invited local artist Lam Tung-pang to serve as a case study for the exhibition, and she highlights Lam's experiences in developing
his career in order to investigate the relationship between contemporary artists, galleries and collectors. She also showcases “Take Home
and Make Real the Priceless In Your Heart”, a series of paintings of crystals by Liu Ding that the artist has commissioned to his precise
specifications. With his signature – a symbol of value and authority – affixed on the back of each painting, the complete work seemingly
transforms the reproductions into priceless collectibles of a renowned artist and thus invites viewers to reflect on the value of a work of art:
is a collector investing in the work itself or in the future potential of the artist? Also presented in the exhibition is “One Square Foot of Sky” by
foreign investment (FI), a collective initially formed by foreign artists. For this work, they have teamed up with four young Hong Kong artists –
Chris Huen Sin-kan, Kong Wing, Dakuen Leung and Wong Ka-ying – to paint the Hong Kong sky above us into “sky shares”, the value of which
is based on the price of property in the district. FI connects their art with daily life to provide a new criterion for considering the price of art.
Encouraging critical thinking and initiating effective discussions around the value of art, the project adopts a “club membership” approach to
act as an incubator for a committed audience to further their knowledge and engagement. A series of activities will continue to be held during
the exhibition period to stimulate a debate between the curator, the guest speakers, the exhibiting artists and the public on the development
and collection of art.
column38:
郭瑛邀請了香港藝術家林東鵬作為一個個案，以他建立藝術事業的經歷，探討當代藝術家與畫廊及收藏家的
關係。另一位參展藝術家劉鼎為我們展示他委約他人複製的水晶石組畫，他於每張畫背後加上了象徵價值
及權威的藝術家簽名，成為作品《帶回家實現心中的無價》，彷彿把複製的畫作瞬間變成了無價的名作，劉
鼎讓觀眾思考藝術品的價值，究竟收藏家投資的是作品本身還是藝術家的未來潛力？《一平方尺的天空》
是藝術組合 foreign investment 的作品，組合由四位海外成員聯同四位香港年青藝術家：禤善勤、江永、打
權及黃嘉瀛組成。他們以水彩繪畫香港的天空，並以樓價作為股價參考指標，製作成「天空股票」。foreign
investment把生活與作品連結起來，為藝術定價提供一個新的考量。
為鼓勵觀眾對「藝術的價值」作深入的思考，這個計劃特別設有「會員制」，展覽期間亦舉辦一連串活動，
鼓勵公眾與客席策展人、藝術家及講者一同參與有關藝術發展及收藏的討論。

column37:
The Animamix Biennale has been held in Shanghai, Beijing, Guangzhou and Taipei since 2007,
showcasing contemporary art under the influence of the unique aesthetic and culture of animation and
comics. In 2013-14, apart from Shanghai and Beijing, Daegu in Korea, Kaohsiung in Taiwan, Macau and
Hong Kong also participate in the festival. vA! and Oi! will collaborate with the City University of Hong
Kong in organising the exhibition to examine ‘time’ and ‘speed’— the intrinsic nature of animation and
comics. The speediness and slowness in animation affects our mental and cognitive perception towards
visual images; while contemporary art often shapes time into grotesques through various media
and technologies. They challenge the established conception of the viewers and open up a broader
aesthetical experience for our sensual world.
column38:
動漫美學雙年展自2007年分別於上海、北京、廣州、台北等地舉行，展示當代藝術在動畫及漫畫影
響下所產生的獨特美學和文化特質。於2013-14年，除了上海、北京外，南韓大邱、高雄、澳門及
香港亦參與其中。香港視覺藝術中心、油街實現聯同香港城市大學，以「時間」及「速度」為探討
的對象，審視動漫藝術本質上的概念。動漫的快與慢影響著我們的心理及對視覺圖像的認知；當代
藝術透過不同媒體塑造時間的奇形怪狀，挑戰觀者既有的觀念，為我們的感官世界開拓更廣闊的視
覺美學體驗。

column37: Tam Hing Kai, a graduate of the Hong Kong Art School's Bachelor of Arts (Fine Art) programme (majoring in Photography) wants to directly record his feelings towards his sick grandmother through the method of Intimate Photography in his solo exhibition, "Tree and Wind". Tam Hing Kai has been living with his grandmother since he was a child until she passed away two years ago. He would like to commemorate his late grandmother in the upcoming exhibition which will end on 4 April, one day before the Ching Ming Festival.
column38: 「樹與風」是譚慶楷─香港藝術學院藝術文學士課程畢業生(主修攝影)以攝影機為工具，嘗試直接地記錄他對患病中祖母的感受，照片中充滿感覺。如果那些照片同樣能在您的心靈中產生回響的話，那可能正就是拍攝者的感受。譚氏自小與祖母同住直到她離世前兩年。每年清明時節總會有很多人帶着各樣的鮮花、祭品，祭祖掃墓，以表達對先人懷念之情。今次展期由三月十一日至四月四日，就是今年清明節前一天結束。
